episodes.title: Pick of the Week #574 – The Dregs #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: You’d think with Josh Flanagan missing, that the show would have been shorter. Somehow we end up giving you 10 bonus minutes of great comics talk as Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick tackle the tough subjects of today’s modern comic book reader. If you see Josh, please tell him we’re worried and we love him, no matter what. But maybe not as much as that damn purple elephant. episodes.title: Talksplode #71 – Judd Winick
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Thanks to iFanboy patrons, it's another iFanboy comic creator interview, or as we call it, the Talksplode. Judd Winick was known to many as a cast member on the third season of The Real World, but he's also a long time comic book veteran, having written and drawn the classic Pedro and Me, Barry Ween Boy Genius, and spending 11 years writing superhero comics for Marvel, DC, and others. These days, Judd is working on the all ages adventure series, Hilo from Random House. Josh and Judd go through the whole comic book career, and have a lot of fun doing it. You can find out more about Judd Winick at juddspillowfort.com. Total Running Time: 01:22:30 Music: “Spaceboy” Smashing Pumpkins

episodes.title: Pick of the Week #572 – Kill or Be Killed #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Caw! It’s time for comics. Some are good. Some are “fine” and others are, as always, infected with that damned Terrigen mist cloud. There’s a bit of rebar talk, and genuine enthusiasm for socks. All that, and dual Rebirth ratings in our make up segment. Also, see if you can find Conor referencing Project Greenlight season 3. It happens. And more. episodes.title: Special Edition – The Lego Batman Movie
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: After stealing everyone’s hearts in The Lego Movie, Batman gets another star turn in The Lego Batman Movie! Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, and surprise special guest Josh Flanagan talk about what worked, what didn’t, and how the entire thing came very close to violating a Sacred Batman Law. Also, the current state of all-ages animated films, the Will Arnett Conundrum, and the relentlessness of Geek Culture! Plus… Ice Pirates? Running Time: 00:35:15 Music: “Who’s the (Bat)Man” Patrick Stump
tags: cloudy with a chance of meatballs

episodes.title: Special Edition Podcast – Riverdale
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s time to go to a place where things are simper, quieter. Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards take a trip to Riverdale, home of Archie, Betty, Veronica, Jughead and the gang where there’s also murder, lesbian kisses, and Luke Perry. The CW’s latest comic book themed show makes a big impression with it’s first episode and we analyze it and argue about where Riverdale actually is. episodes.author: ifanboy.com

episodes.title: Talksplode #70 – Jason Aaron
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Thanks to iFanboy patrons, it’s Talksplode time. As we wind down the year, we thought that the best person to chat with the winner of the Eisner Award for Best Writer, friend of the show Jason Aaron. From the experience of being the bell of the ball at the Eisners for Southern Bastards, to bringing back Doctor Strange on a monthly basis, to laying out four years worth of Thor stories, to working on the most popular licensed comic, Star Wars. Plus insight to the secrets of Jason Aaron such as tales from his childhood and his lifelong dream to write and draw his own comic book about an Elephant who Rolls Tide. Total Running Time: 01:05:46 Music: “A Very Merry Ho Ho Ho” Akira The Don

episodes.title: Pick of the Week Podcast – Episode 563 – Hal Jordan and the Green Lantern Corps #9
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It's a post-Thanksgiving celebration, as Conor and Ron are joined by Ron's sister's dog. Who knows where Josh is. If you hear from him, can you tell him to call us? We're thankful for comics and excited for the holidays despite Josh going missing. episodes.title: Talksplode #69 – Mark Russell
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Thanks to iFanboy patrons, it’s Talksplode time. When we read Prez, we were impressed, and when, shockingly, The Flintstones series was discovered to be one of the best and smartest new comics from DC, we had to find out who this Mark Russell was. So we asked him. Working with cartoonist Shannon Wheeler, Russell released God Is Disappointed in You, and Apochrypha Now from Top Shelf, as well as various other freelance writing, he then found himself with an opportunity to write Prez for DC Comics. We talk with him about that, and bringing that same sensibility to the licensed property of The Flintstones. Total Running Time: 00:52:33 Music: “Caveman” Jimmy Eat World

episodes.title: Booksplode #15 – Dark Knight: A True Batman Story
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It's back! Thanks to our awesome Patrons, it's the return of the Booksplode! What's a Booksplode you might ask? It's a bi-monthly special edition podcast in which we take a look at a single graphic novel or collected edition, something we really just don't have time to do on the regular show. This month we are reviewing Dark Knight: A True Batman Story from writer Paul Dini and artist Eduardo Risso. Running Time: 00:31:42 Music: "Time Spent in Los Angeles" Dawes

episodes.title: Talksplode #68 – Corinna Bechko and Gabriel Hardman
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Thanks the iFanboy Patrons...Talksplode is back on a monthly release schedule! And we couldn’t be happier to kick things off with the creative team of Corinna Bechko and Gabriel Hardman. Longtime collaborators in both life and comics, Bechko and Hardman moved into creator owned success with their sci-fi/political epic Invisible Republic. Josh Flanagan chats with them about working on licensed properties, their own original works and of course...pets. Total Running Time: 01:28:36 Music: “Familiar Love” William Shatner

More work?” “Well, Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards and special guest Mike Romo wouldn’t call it work, exactly. It’s fun to–” “No one else available…” “Now, wait a minute.” “Okay.” “Don’t be mean. episodes.title: Talksplode #67 - Tom King and Mitch Gerads
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s time for a good old fashioned comic book creator talk! Josh Flanagan talks to comic creators and collaborators Tom King, and Mitch Gerads, about their work on Vertigo’s Sheriff of Babylon, as well as Tom’s work on The Vision, Omega Men, and Batman. Plus Mitch spent a while on Punisher and The Activity. We talk about their working together, Mitch’s stylistic past, Tom’s past with the CIA, as well as iFanboy’s secret part in the forming of this relationship. There’s a bit of talk about the industry, and a lot about the craft of comic book making. Plus we have a good time, and try to get to the bottom of how to pronounce “Gerads”. Total Running Time: 01:11:37 Music: “King of Rock” Run DMC

episodes.title: Pick of the Week Podcast – Episode #531 - Star Wars Special: C-3PO #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Let’s just start with an apology. This week we had a rough time with the recording and the audio quality in general is not up to our standards. Ron Richards is on hotel Wi-fi in Orlando, Josh Flanagan had intermittent connectivity issues at his home base and we might be listening to Conor Kilpatrick slowly dying before our very ears. So we’re sorry about the audio quality. As for the content of the show itself, we cannot apologize. After 11 years, it is what it is. Enjoy! episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The iFanboy Animation Brain Trust — Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt — reconvene to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie: Justice League vs. Teen Titans! Can fan-and-Animation-Braintrust-favorite writer Bryan Q. Miller save these New 52 version films from themselves? Plus! Hope springs eternal with Batman: The Killing Joke this summer and looking ahead to movies possibly set after the Rebirth! Running Time: 00:40:17 Music: “Surrender” Cheap Trick

episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: While Ron, Conor, and Josh all agreed it was an exemplary week of comics, there’s a lot of mud slung this week. Something’s in the air, apparently. Either way, all the hail the coming of Space George Lucas! In celebration, we went long. episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Ron Richards is off doing amazing professional things, apparently, so we’ve pulled in a ringer with Jeff Cannata to guest host with Josh and Conor. And we think it worked out OK. episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Deadpool
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The unthinkable has happened, the Deadpool movies was not only made and released, but it’s delighting fans around the world with the violence, sex and hijinks. Conor and Ron gather to discuss and breakdown the Merc With a Mouth’s jump to the big screen and what they got oh so right and what they got wrong (spoiler: not much). So strap in and get ready for some insane Deadpool talk! Running Time: 00:28:11 Music: “Calendar Girl” Neil Sedaka

episodes.title: Pick of the Week Podcast – Episode #521 - Unfollow #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor, Josh, and Ron are together again, and yet separated by many miles, just as they like it. The comics of the week come up, sure, and a great many wonderful comics they are. But there’s also a heck of a diversion on the concept of just what a sandwich is, and a literary discussion! Because that’s the kind of show we run. And we don’t apologize. episodes.summary: The iFanboy Animation Brain Trust — Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt — reconvene to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie! episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #501 - We Stand On Guard #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Reunited and it's never felt so good. To celebrate over 500 episodes of the podcast, Josh Flanagan, Conor Kilpatrick, and Ron Richards get together for an unprecedented live stream podcast recording. For OVER THREE HOURS, the guys take YOUR questions and talk comics, the past 500 episodes and many other embarrassing stories. If you missed the live stream, no worries, we have the entire audio here for your enjoyment. So pop open a cold one, pull up a chair and get ready for the epic 501st episode. Running Time: 03:13:54 00:02:54 - We Stand On Guard #3 Audience Questions: 00:17:54 - The tradition continues as we field questions from the loyal iFanbase for 3 hours straight. Listen as the iFanboy trio slowly fall apart, talking comics to the very bitter end. - Adrian from Newastle, Australia wants to know which series the iFanboy used to love but don't anymore. And also which color lightsaber they would wield. - Matthew M. asks which was iFanboy's favorite series canceled before its time. - Charles T. from Front Royal, VA asks about which Marvel characters would wear the different Lantern rings and wants to know about DC and Image's digital plans. - Lukas B. from Neulengbach, Austria asks about murder mystery comics, Showcase Presents, music pairings with comics, and doppelgängers. - Michael T. (and Brian C.) wants to know about the role of religion in superhero comic books. - Matt W. from Charlotte, NC asks about Supergods and special edition podcasts. - Nick P. from Luxembourg via Newport Beach, CA is looking for classic X-Men and Spider-Man stories, asks about Lucifer, and how to fix DC's Robin problem. - Wes from Newport, MN wants to know who would write and draw the comic book version of the iFanboy story. - Chris J. from Whitby, Ontario, Canada asks about what the iFanboys have learned about hosting a podcast. - Tom F. thinks maybe listeners should occasionally get to make the Pick of the Week. - Teemu from Helsinki, Finland wants the iFanboys to come up with a special Top 5 list. - Jarret G. is curious about the iFanboys' preferred time and location for reading comics. - Adam O. from Dayton, OH wants to know if Marvel's top writers went to DC, which books would they write? - Mike G. from Ottawa, Canada is curious if Josh still has that Lego TIE fighter. - David G. from Worcester, MA has a question about the Ultimate universe. - Edward G. is looking to play a word association game. - Adam S. wants to know why certain writers get more leeway than others. - Tom D. from Grand Isle, VT wants to delve into the question of continuity. - Andrew H. wants to know what the iFanboy would do if they were in charge of Marvel's Star Wars line. - Eric E. asks about the comic books that most influenced the iFanboys, personally. - Jay K. from South Carolina has a friend who makes him feel bad for reading comic books digitally. - Matt K. from Long Island, NY wants Conor to do a specific sponsor read. - Phil A. (and Travis R.) from Pennsylvania has a question about how to podcast. - Jason S. wants to know why DC used to be better at continuity. - Adam from Central Florida is curious if the iFanboys have changed their habits from four years ago. - Ray D. wants to know if Ron still dislikes Morrison's New X-Men and if anyone's opinions have changed on The Dark Knight. - Gabe A. from sometimes Cambridge, MA and sometimes Santa Monica, CA used to be deep into comic book culture but isn't anymore. He wants to know what the iFanboys do to keep up? - Brian W. from Atlanta, GA wants to know if there are any Pick of the Week regrets. - Dan C. wants to know how the Pick of the Week is determined. - Dave from Los Angeles, CA wants to know if people actually start reading comic books anywhere other than with the first issue. - Wayne from Chula Vista, CA wants the iFanboys to do a special edition podcast on Seveneves. - Patrick K. of Rohan wants to know where the fear of rebar came from. - Zach G. from Virginia asks a question about fried chicken that throws the entire rest of the night into disarray. - Ken O. from Madison Heights, MI asks about certain superheroes' favorite music. - Stuart C. from Sydney, Australia wants to know how Josh feels when one of his impressions doesn't land. - Stuart from Hampshire, England thinks that surely DC and Marvel will have to retire their old characters and create new ones. - Scott C. from Fort Wayne, Indiana asks a deep question about the nature of criticism. - Joe B. from St. Louis, MO asks about books that the iFanboys have enjoyed for the entirety of the run of the podcast. - Tom C. from Newcastle, UK asks about comic books that don't take place in cities, Conor's college sex life, and Ron's job status. - Vincent from Westchester wants to know why the success of all of these comic book movies has not lead to booming comic book sales. - Allan H. is a DC fan who is unhappy with DC and wants to know if he should jump ship to Marvel. - Brian C. from Cleveland, OH wants to know if DC will reboot again when the New 52 titles hit their #52 and if the iFanboys could buy sketches for each other, what would they be and who would draw them? - Greg O. from Hastings NE wants Tom Katers to come back on the show. - Jason S. from Knoxville, TN wants to know if, when the show is over, the iFanboys will quite reading single issues (or comics altogether), how - Ron's time at Image Comics affected his comic book reading, and how the music on the show changed when Ron left. - Ryan J. from Northfield, MN asks about the song choices that go with each podcast. - Kerby O. from Austin, TX asks which Star Wars characters should have nicknames like "Lo"/Lobot. - Bill S. from Kansas City wants to know why the iFanboy hate Fables. - Miroslav L. from Croatia is curious about the most important thing when it comes to recording a weekly podcast. - James V. from Brentwood, TN wants to know which comic book creators Ron knows personally and has a bizarre question about pudding. - Brandon C. wants to know about the iFanboys' most embarrassing moment related to comics. - Joe C. wants to know what the best documentary about The Civil War is other than The Civil War, also he wants to know what the best book is. - Tom K. from Washington DC has a bone to pick with Ron and reveals what Dick Grayson and Barbara Gordon's relationship is in the New 52. - Kyle O. from Winnipeg, Ontario, Canada wants to know about the process of creating the podcast every week. episodes.title: Talksplode #66 - Mark Millar
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: You know who Mark Millar is. He’s the creative superpower behind so many comics and by extension films made from those comics. Josh Flanagan had a great conversation with the writer behind The Ultimates, Old Man Logan, Wanted, Kick-Ass, Starlight, MPH, Jupiters Circle, Chrononauts, the upcoming Huck, and so many more, you might as well just go to Wikipedia. We talk to Mark about his work, his career from the very beginning, and what it’s like to be Mark Millar right now. It turns out, it’s pretty good. We chat about the idea that some accused Millar of only making comics to be made into movies, and where he stands on digital comics today. Settle in and enjoy the brogue. You can go to Millarworld to see everything Mark has going on, and follow him on twitter, @mrmarkmillar. Total Running Time: 00:56:48 Music: “Banana Splits” The Dickies

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #500 - We Can Never Go Home #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s the 500th episode of the Pick of the Week Podcast recorded on Jack Kirby’s birthday aaaand Josh Flanagan isn’t here. But Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards, both very tired, are here and there’s a lot of comic book talk to be had ahead of next week’s big episode! Running Time: 00:58:17 Comics: 00:01:48 - We Can Never Go Home #4 00:10:18 - Hank Johnson: Agent of Hydra #1 00:13:18 - Superman #43 00:17:05 - S.H.I.E.L.D. #9 00:25:41 - We Are…Robin! #3 00:27:52 - Prez #3 00:33:47 - Grayson #11 00:34:36 - Star Wars: Lando #3 00:36:50 - Cyborg #2 Audience Questions: 00:39:38 – Vincent F. from Philadelphia, PA loves Silver Age comics and is curious about the Golden Age. 00:43:47 – Michael K. from Tennessee (and Andy B.) wants to talk about the recent rumors about DC’s financial troubles. Brought To You By: Geek Nation Tours - New York Comic Con! Middle Earth! Star Wars Celebration! Book your geek tour today! Or make a one time donation of any amount! Music: “Theme from ‘New York, New York’” Frank Sinatra

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #499 - Astro City #26
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s throwback week at iFanboy! Conor Kilparick and Ron Richards return to New York where it all started, while a special anniversary Pick of the Week makes Josh Flanagan extremely uncomfortable. Running Time: 00:58:16 Comics: 00:01:47 – Astro City #26 00:11:51 - 1872 #2 00:17:05 - Archie #2 00:22:29 - Birthright #10 00:23:52 - Star Wars #8 00:30:24 - Hip Hop Family Tree #1 00:34:10 - Trees #12 00:36:13 - Howard the Human #1 00:38:01 - Invincible #122 00:40:50 - Secret Wars: Secret Love #1 Audience Questions: 00:42:45 - Andrew M. from Santa Cruz, CA is irritated by a particular phrase used in some comics criticism. 00:47:43 - Brian K. wants iFanboy to expand their comic book scope. Or make a one time donation of any amount! Music: “Now Sleep Till Brooklyn” The Beastie Boys

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #498 - Batman #43
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This time Ron Richards is away (in lovely and scenic Anaheim, CA) so it’s up to Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan to talk about the week in comics, standing in lines, and sweet beards and even sweeter suits. Running Time: 01:01:49 Comics: 00:01:38 - Batman #43 00:11:35 - Batman/Superman #23 00:16:17 - Action Comics #43 00:19:08 - Velvet #11 00:22:56 - Phonogram: The Immaterial Girl #1 00:28:16 - Stumptown #7 00:31:32 - The Fade Out #8 00:34:10 - Starve #3 00:36:58 - Letter 44 #19 00:38:53 – Lando #2 Audience Questions: 00:41:37 – Justin L. wants to know about ironic Picks of the Week and general negativity. 00:47:10 – John from Manchester, UK isn’t a fan of serialized storytelling. Or make a one time donation of any amount! Music: “Take On Me” A-Ha

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #497 - Airboy #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor is off in Deutschland leaving Josh and Ron to fend for themselves with this week's comics. A startling streak for the meta drama of Airboy and the inevitable happens as Ron compares comics to baseball and then Josh compares them to The Daily Show. Running Time: 01:01:05 Comics: 00:02:31 - Airboy #3 00:12:34 - The Wicked + The Divine #13 00:19:43 - Midnighter #3 00:23:50 - Darth Vader #8 00:27:27 - Deadly Class #15 00:30:54 - Ultimate End #4 00:36:46 - This Damned Band #1 00:38:22 - The Omega Men #3 00:40:28 - We Stand on Guard #2 00:41:26 - Creepy #21 00:42:45 - Savage Dragon #205 Audience Questions: 00:43:50 - Clint from Las Vegas has got a question about when explicit comics go too far? Or make a one time donation of any amount! Music: "They / Them / Theirs" Worriers

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Fantastic Four
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The last superhero movie of 2015 goes out with a whimper, as Ron Richards is joined by long time friend of iFanboy, Jeff Cannata to discuss just what the hell happened with this latest reboot of the first family of comics, the Fantastic Four. Running Time: 00:29:50 Music: “Lorna Doom" Rocket From The Crypt

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #496 - Batgirl Annual #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Oh...hello there. Nice to see you again. We're just here in the iFanboy backyard enjoying some comics, won't you join us? Pull up a chair and some lemonade and we'll get you a slice of pie....along with Wormie!

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Justice League: Gods and Monsters
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The iFanboy Animation Brain Trust — Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt — reconvene to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie! Bruce Timm returns to the series he once oversaw! Did he bring the magic with him? Plus! Looking forward to Batman: Bad Blood and more Damian Wayne! (Just kidding: no one is looking forward to that.)

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #495 – Prez #25
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Things run a bit amok as Josh Flanagan makes his pick and Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards hop on the Long Island Expressway to go for a ride. The usual comics mirth is added by distractions and X-Boxes...lots and lots of X-Boxes.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #494 – Astro City #25
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This week on iFanboy: Conor Kilpatrick is not prepared to say when a series ends, Josh Flanagan has an unpleasant realization about cartoon character bathroom habits, and Ron Richards threatens those who would not support the show.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Ant-Man
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Join Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, and former iFanboy staffer Mike Romo for a short chat about the silver screen debut of the World’s Tiniest Hero–Ant-Man! Also known as Yellow Jacket. Running Time: 00:34:18 Music: “Small Talk” Immaculate Machine

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #493 – 1872 #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Conor broadcasting on broken equipment from the vicinity of San Diego Comic-Con, and Ron and Josh safely hundreds of miles away, we tackle a very good week of comics, starting with a western surprise. We ask, what is it that makes a Lobot, and oh how we laughed.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #492 – Airboy #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Despite our best efforts Ron Richards is still here and let's just all start coming to terms with that. So with Conor Kilpatrick dialing in from a secret location full of birds and Josh Flanagan slipping in one more question for Ron about working at Image Comics, it's time for three jamokes to talk about some comic books. (Warning: there are a few instances of audio interference.)

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #491 – Howard The Duck #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Who says you can't come home again? Prodigal son Ron Richards returns to the welcoming arms of Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick to talk about this week's books and you know what? Not much has changed in almost 3 years...

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #490 – Southern Bastards #9
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Our old pal Paul Montgomery from Panels.net shows up to join Conor Kilpatrick to talk the week in comics, how you know when it is time to move from issues to trades, and why Josh might end up in a Federal penitentiary!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #489 – Starve #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick have gone full idiot, and they intend to prove it. Josh can’t get through the lineup of a superhero team without convulsing with laughter, and Conor won’t face facts about what a last issue is, and can’t say Starfire. Also: #notmyjohn begins now!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #488 – Airboy #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick is back to talk about the week in comics with Josh Flanagan! Creative ennui, Star Wars ennui, suburban ennui–they’ve got all the ennui you could possibly need… all in one show!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #487 – Where Monsters Dwell #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: So, uh, this has never happened before, but a series of events have left us with only one host this week. So Josh forges onward by his lonesome, and his fatigue is palpable. But the week’s comics still get covered, and then there’s some free-for-all at the end. This will never happen again. Maybe.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #486 – The Fade Out #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This week Conor Kilpatrick imposes a harsh new rule for the audience questions and Josh Flanagan admits that he might have a drinking problem. Wait… what? Josh? (Also, there’s comics talk.)

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #485 – Rebels #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan talk about the week that was in comics. But if what you’re really looking for is an in-depth report on the current medical status of Josh’s dog…this is the show for you.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #484 – Secret Wars #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Two jamokes go at it again, and luckily, they are given the greatest collection of names of letter writers we've yet experienced. Also, big talk about the big things in comics, with the pick being a big book from the big company. Also, all the books are ending.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #483 – Inhuman #14
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Last week, Josh Flanagan put out a call for audience questions about art and artists and boy did you people deliver! This week, he and Conor Kilpatrick talk about art as well as the new comics of the week. Plus Conor reveals a fantasy he has about Josh.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Avengers: Age of Ultron
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: As the Avengers assemble again so must the original iFanboys! Ron Richards joins Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan to discuss the latest chapter of the Marvel Cinematic Universe–Avengers: Age of Ultron!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #482 – The Black Hood #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick will talk about comics even if they can no longer remember the names of any of the characters in them. That is their level of dedication to you and to themselves. Also, Josh completely flabbergasts Conor with a display of genuine emotion, comes to a startling realization about himself, and makes a forthright plea to the audience. It’s fun!

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Daredevil
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan are joined by former iFanboy columnist Mike Romo to talk about the 13-hour original series (from the partnership of Netflix and Marvel Studios) featuring real estate crime and punching–so much punching–Daredevil!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #481 – Chrononauts #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan has returned from the Caribbean, and he’s way chill. This is good, because there were not a lot of books this week, so he and Conor talk about some comics, then dive into a lot of listeners questions, and finally, well, there’s some Star Wars talk. Obviously.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Batman vs. Robin
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The iFanboy Animation Brain Trust — Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt — reconvene to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie! One of them loved it, one of them thought it was okay, and one of them thought it was boring. But which is which?

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #480 – Astro City #22
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Josh Flanagan off on vacation, desperately hiding from the harsh and unforgiving rays of the sun, former co-host Paul Montgomery returns to chat about comics with Conor Kilpatrick. How much Convergence talk is too much Convergence talk? They might be pushing the limits this week.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #479 – Black Science #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Darwyn Cooke and WonderCon made this show very late. Blame him and it. Certainly not Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan–it’s not their fault!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #478 – The Multiversity: Ultra Comics #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh and Conor get deep on comic book allegory and metatext. Or they’re just making stuff up? Who can tell? Who is more annoying? Hitler or Darkseid? There’s only one way to find the answer!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #477 – Invisible Republic #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: WonderCon plans, Josh Flanagan’s Netflix habits, and Conor Kilpatrick’s fear of robots are all revealed this week!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #476 – Ms. Marvel #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This week, Conor Kilpatrick returns from the freezing east coast to re-join Josh Flanagan to talk the week that was in comics PLUS northeast accents! Story balls.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #475 - Big Man Plans #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor is in the wind, and Jim Viscardi of comicbook.com and Let’s Talk Comics ably joins the fray with Josh Flanagan, who has trouble keeping time, and is worried what Conor will say on his return. But there is agreement on the Pick of the Week, and many good new comics out this week that need vigorous discussion. Mostly vigorous anyway. There are also a whole lot of #1 issues.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #474 - Criminal: Special Edition #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This week, Josh Flanagan comes to a troubling realization, Conor Kilpatrick is traumatized, and an age old iFanboy debate returns!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #473 - Lazarus #15
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This week, Josh Flanagan has started taking on the qualities of a dictator and he and Conor Kilpatrick deal with a hard-hitting existential life question. Also — comics!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #472 - Southern Bastards #7
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Love is in the air, and two morons who don’t know how the kids text are here to give you their advice about it, after dispensing with the best and most notable comics of the week. It’s the Valentine’s Day special podcast. So sit back with the one you love, and enjoy our thoughts on sequential art and romance, one of which we know quite a lot about.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #471 - Hawkeye #21
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: And then there were two: with Paul Montgomery following Ron Richards off into the sunset, Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick carry on as a comic book chatting duo!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #470 - Batman #38
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul Montgomery rides off into the sunset as a regular co-host of the show, but before he goes it’s time to talk about the week that was in comics one more time with Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick. Also poetic Picks, numerology, and Slash’s bitchin’ guitar solo in “November Rain.”

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Justice League: Throne of Atlantis
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The iFanboy Animation Braintrust — Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt — wants to be under the sea, in an Atlantian’s garden in the shade! Aquaman takes the starring role in a film that doesn’t even feature his name! Does Justice League: Throne of Atlantis sink… or does it swim? Running Time: 00:42:36 Music: “(Sitting On) The Dock of the Bay” Otis Redding

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #469 - Batman/Superman #18
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Two men, a somewhat middling week of comics, Arby’s, Elias Koteas, and more are in store for you dear listener. With Conor away “working”, Paul and Josh make with the deep comics talk, with all the flourish you’re used to, and only moderate off topic diversions. It turns out another artist needs to just stop it. Find out who! Finally, you never use the phone!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #468 - Star Wars #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The gang is back together… just in time to split up! With the iFanboy Pick of the Week Podcast set to lose another one if its co-hosts in a few weeks, there is still time for Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Paul Montgomery to talk about comic books together. And talk about Star Wars. Talk so much about Star Wars.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #467 - The Fade Out #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: We’re (mostly) back! Old friends Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan tell old jokes, and feel old and talk about old things, and comic books about people who would be old. Old. But it’s also very good to be back on the comics horse talking about the books of the week after the holidays. Help us shake the rust off and get back to picking of the week. Won’t you join us? There’s some war talk. We can’t help it.

episodes.title: 2014 iFanboy All-Media Year End Round-Up
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s the ninth annual iFanboy All-Media Year End Round-Up! Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and special guest Mike Romo discuss some of what they enjoyed in media in 2014. Movies, television, podcasts, books, video games, and comics–it’s all here!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #466 - Afterlife with Archie #7
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It's the last Pick of the Week of the year, and Paul, Conor, and Josh celebrate with a discussion of Afterlife with Archie #7, and a detailed look at 2014's Picks of the Week by the numbers!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #465 - Birthright #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul Montgomery is traveling by train, and that leaves Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan to try to fill time on their own. So of course a bit of Jaws came up, maybe Man of Steel, and Josh can’t remember the B-29, which is different than the B-52. Plus all the books from the week, more art appreciation than anyone can deal with, and special guest Kevin Costner!* *There is no Kevin Costner

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #464 - Rasputin #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s a special Thansgiving-shortened episode!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #463 - The Multiversity: Pax Americana #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The holiday season kicks off with Josh Flanagan being a jerk, Conor Kilpatrick getting emotional about Morrison and Quitely, and Paul Montgomery doing his best to hold it all together.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #462 - Wytches #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Introducing: War Corner. From now on and always.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #461 - Rocket Raccoon #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: What say we try it with all three?

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #460 - Wonder Woman #35
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: We don’t know where Paul Montgomery went. He’s gone somewhere. So ComicBook.com editor-in-chief James Viscardi sits down with Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick to talk about the week in comics, so many Marvel movies, and their awkward collective northeastern view of the deep south.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick, Mike Romo, and iFanboy co-founder Ron Richards have written, directed, produced, and starred in a little show they like to call What We Talk About When We Talk About Birdman or (The Most Mind-Bendingly-Blowingly Viscerally Raw Movie Experience of 2015)! Caw! Running Time: 00:43:59 Music: “Crazy” Gnarls Barkley

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #459 - She-Hulk #9
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Yeah, so Conor's gone again, and he's the one who usually keeps time, so this show ran a little long, because Josh Flanagan and Paul Montgomery can't shut their yaps. And we're not kidding. Josh definitely overshares. But there are also wonderful comics to be parsed, and this couple of snobs does just that.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Constantine
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The Season of the Comic Book TV Show concludes, for now, with NBC’s Constantine! Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery have conjured up a spoiler-filled discussion about the pilot episode that stars Matt Ryan as John Constantine! Listen as they try to review a pilot whose core concept and female lead have already been scrapped for the second episode! Running Time: 00:20:48 Music: “The Ghost Inside” Broken Bells

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #458 - Deadpool's Art of War #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Hey! All three hosts are on the show… at the same time! Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Josh Flanagan discuss the week in comics, Josh’s college roommate, stories from the Civil War, and comic book movies. So many comic book movies.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #457 - Batman #35
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Josh Flanagan off attempting to sabotage a wedding and ruin dozens of lives, Conor Kilpatrick and Panels' own Paul Montgomery bond over an unexpected mutual appreciation for -- you'll never believe it -- the comic books.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - The Flash
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The Season of the Comic Book TV Show continues on The CW as The Flash spins out of Arrow! Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery have partnered up to have a spoiler-filled discussion about the pilot episode that stars Grant Guston as Barry Allen/The Flash! Running Time: 00:28:10 Music: “Run Wild” Ume

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #456 - Detective Comics #35
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Now Paul Montgomery is back with Josh Flanagan, but Conor Kilpatrick is traveling to places unknown (likely drunkenly). It turns out the two available hosts have many nice things to say about a great number of comic books, just before ending it with telling you what’s wrong with you, the comic book reader. Then saying something nice. It’s a good balance, actually. And the trouble with plaid!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #455 - Sex #16
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Paul Montgomery off on assignment this week, Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan plow forward into the world of comic books… as a duo! Are they Simon and Garfunkel… or Simon and Simon? Or both? There’s only one way to find out!

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Gotham
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The Season of the Comic Book TV Show begins tonight! Fox kicks things off at 8pm with Gotham, the gritty cop show set in a pre-Batman Gotham City! Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery have partnered up to have a spoiler-filled discussion about the pilot episode that stars Ben McKenzie as a new-in-town Detective James Gordon and Donal Logue as his new partner Detective Harvey Bullock! Running Time: 00:27:39

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #454 - Thor: God of Thunder #25
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor and Paul skedaddled and left Josh to fill your earbuds with the sounds of guests Ali Colluccio and Ryan Haupt. Right off, fatigue has rendered Josh a bumbling fool, and then he exits the show in some sort of low grade medical emergency. But before all that, there’s talk of the consumption of fermented sharks, the value of coloring, and even some comic book talk. It’s a humdinger, clearly. Bonus for finding the hidden Spider-Verse talk!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #453 - Wild’s End #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Oh, it's one of those episodes.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #452 - God Hates Astronauts #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Doing a show about comic books for 452 straight weeks takes dedication--and none are more dedicated than Josh Flanagan who calls in this week from a secret bunker location in the American northeast! Conor Kilpatrick and Panels.net's Paul Montgomery are also on the show but, you know, they just dialed in like normal.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #451 - All-Star Western #34
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: iFanboy continues to blaze trails with a milestone 451st episode. In a fit of jubilation, Joshua ventures out for another of his wilderness jags, only for Jeff Cannata to turn up on the next train from Carson City. Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery toss him a tin star and we're off, little dogies!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #450 - The Fade Out #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: iFanboy celebrates its 450th episode with an extra-sized all listener e-mail spectacular! Josh Flanagan, Paul Montgomery, and Conor Kilpatrick asked you, the iFanbase, to send us e-mails on any topic you wanted and you delivered!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #449 - Batman #34
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul Montgomery is away somewhere, so his media rival Jim Viscardi has taken up the chair, and has been forced to endure the antics and bad french of Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan. And yet, as always, there will be comics talk, unshakable references to television from the 90s, and nearly genuine camaraderie.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Batman: Assault on Arkham
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Let's go to prison! The iFanboy Animation Braintrust of Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt wake up in a sparse cell, tasked with evaluating the latest home video release from DC Animation. Is Batman: Assault on Arkham worth the time in the pokey, or should we throw away the key? Running Time: 00:34:56 Music: "Chain Gang" Sam Cooke

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #448 - Rocket Raccoon #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick is back from vacation to join Josh Flanagan and Paul Montgomery to talk about the week in comics! Also, old iPads, Batman ’89, and Paul’s got some big news!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #447 - Low #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor is still on hols, and we’ve still got a bloody show to do, eh wot? Josh Flanagan and Paul Montgomery are joined by the sultan of sloth science himself, Ryan Haupt, in which he talks of some science. It’s a good time, fraught with many comics indeed. Plus squid knowledge!

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - ‘Guardians of the Galaxy’
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Come and get your love. Prodigal son Ron Richards returns to school Josh Flanagan, Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt on the proper navigation of a special edition podcast. Their topic? The magical, musical, mirthful Guardians of the Galaxy. But does everyone find it so charming? Yes. Yes, spoilers, they do. Running Time: 00:38:50 Music: "Come and Get Your Love" Redbone

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #446 - Ragnarok #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Conor off at San Diego Comic Con 2014, Ali Colluccio steps in to join Josh Flanagan and Paul Montgomery to talk the very serious business of comic books. At some point a toilet is flushed. Oh my!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #445 - Life with Archie #36
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: One week before San Diego Comic-Con and things get spicy on the show! Paul Montgomery might be on drugs, Conor Kilpatrick’s feeling feisty, and Josh Flanagan hates everything this week except for 1980s pony tails.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #444 - Daredevil #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh, Paul and Conor affect robot voices for a little while and then talk about comic books in this one.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #443 - Moon Knight #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul from Philadelphia, you’re on the air! Mere moments before the show was set to record, Tropical Storm Arthur, making its way up the east coast, knocked out Paul Montgomery’s power. But he’s a professional and won’t let that stop him talking about the week in comics with Conor Kilpatrick!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #442 - Superman #32
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This week: terrible costume designs, hair metal, polar bears, and polar madness! Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and temp host Josh Flanagan get into all the comics of the week and perform jokes at a very low hit rate. This week, we’ve got 100% less scientific points of view and Ghostbuster discussions. Plus, we do the July Book of the Month super early.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #441 - The Wicked + The Divine #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Did someone call for the doctor? Josh Flanagan's off who knows where, doing who knows what--so former iFanboy columnist, current member of the iFanboy Animation Braintrust, and co-host of Science...sort of, Ryan Haupt joins Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick to talk about the week in comics! Also, dinosaurs. Lots of talking about dinosaurs.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #440 – The Royals: Masters of War #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: What we talk about when we talk about Ghostbusters. And Batman '89. And maybe even some comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #439 – Smallville: Lantern #12
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul is going to watch Ghostbusters! Also, we talk about comics. We’ll have to talk about Ghostbusters later. We suppose it’s still worth listening to, if you’re into that thing.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #438 – Deadly Class #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Comics! Drugs! Vegas! Josh Flanagan, Paul Montgomery, and Conor Kilpatrick are back once again to discuss the week that was in comics! Plus, a startling admission by Paul leads to one of the longer digressions in recent memory!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #437 – Flash Gordon #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Special guest host Josh Flanagan joins Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick to chat about the week in comic books! Plus, everyone has trouble remembering things, and Josh weighs in on the TV adaptation of his favorite comic book character!

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - X-Men: Days of Future Past
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: As the X-Men return to the past so to does iFanboy as co-founder Ron Richards returns to the show to talk X-Men: Days of Future Past with Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery! Running Time: 00:46:35 Music: “Time in a Bottle” Jim Croce

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #436 – Action Comics #31
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With their milestone 1000th iTunes review achieved, iFanboy shakes up the roster! Now that Josh Flanagan has retired (not really), incumbent iFanboy Jeff Cannata joins Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery for his very first show! It's also as good a time as any to discuss the massive wave of new comic book properties heading to television next season!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #435 – The Wake #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery and Josh Flanagan are dancing monkeys for you amusement. But can a monkey read comics and then tell you the best one? Well?? Can they???

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Son of Batman
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The iFanboy Animation Brain Trust — Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt — reconvene to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie! How does the film stack up against the other Batman offerings? What does a shared universe of animated films mean for the future of the film series? Was it a mistake to bring Damian back in the comics in the first place? All of this is discussed… and more! Running Time: 00:36:06 Music: “Father and Son (with Fiona Apple)” Johnny Cash

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #434 – Southern Bastards #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery and Josh Flanagan buck format and decide to talk comics, though technically that's what they do every week. It's not all fun and games though. Just as Josh and Conor's staged intervention over Paul's pro wrestling fandom crumbles, Josh confronts a lifelong donut fixation.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - The Amazing Spider-Man 2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and former iFanboy writer Timmy Wood collectively do whatever a spider can! Assuming that what a spider can do is gather together to discuss The Amazing Spider-Man 2! Running Time: 00:43:59 Music: “Spider-Man Theme [Junkie XL Remix]” Michael Buble

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #433 – Lazarus #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan, Paul Montgomery, and Conor Kilpatrick like a lot of comics this week, and that’s way better than other weeks when they didn’t like any comics. Also, find out what Paul likes to do with a shovel and a corpse. Then there are some out of practice voices at the end. Plus, we’re on the march to 1,000 reviews. Then we’re done!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #432 – Stray Bullets: Killers #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan is tired, Conor Kilpatrick is hung over, and Paul Montgomery is Paul Montgomery, as the guys return to talk about the week that was in comics! No one dies at the end of this episode. We think.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #431 – All-New X-Men #25
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan is still back, just in time for a major schism! After nearly a year of congenial discussion, the iFanboys amiably disagree on a book they never thought would be a point of contention. There are also laughs in abundance, as Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick walk Josh through a vaguely cheery postpartum fugue state. Comics!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #430 – Starlight #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It's no dream. Josh Flanagan is back, and it's his Pick of the Week. Will he let Paul finish a sentence? Yes, but not all of them. It was a tough week to have to make the call, but it was not without highlights. Finally, Josh has some parting words for his partners.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - Captain America: The Winter Soldier
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The past has returned to haunt Captain America (in more ways than one) in Captain America: The Winter Soldier... and iFanboy has returned to talk about it! Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and special guest Jeff Cannata from DLC and Newest Latest Best are called into duty to talk all things Captain America, speculate on where the story will go next, and contemplate the possibility of a Civil War film! Running Time: 00:43:44 Music: “A Hazy Shade of Winter” Simon and Garfunkel

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #429 – The Private Eye #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Josh Flanagan still nowhere to be found, Let’s Talk Comics host James Viscardi returns to the show to join Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick to discuss the week that was in comics, plus anonymous browser searches, unusual homework assignments in high school, and the difficulties of reading comics in the shower!

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - ‘Marvel’s Avengers Confidential: Black Widow and Punisher’
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Marvel's most accomplished spy and its deadliest vigilante team up for lengthy briefings and dangerous field operations in the latest direct-to-video animated feature from Madhouse. Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt engage in a brief, not so clandestine discussion of this curious team-up. Running Time: 00:29:49 Music: “Rush” Seatbelts

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #428 – American Vampire: Second Cycle #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan's still off on paternity leave so this week Paul Montgomery calls upon his Fuzzy Typewriter co-host Dave Accampo to join himself and Conor Kilpatrick to talk about the week in comic books!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #427 – Batman #29
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Josh Flanagan off on paternity leave, Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick tag in Ali Colluccio to discuss the best of the week in comics, dirigibles, grim-dark nihilism, and scotchy scotch scotch.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #426 – Afterlife with Archie #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Josh Flanagan gather together to discuss the week that was in comics books, including lots of number one issues! Plus, The Yellow King, Adele Nazeem, and no one wants to live with one of the iFanboys!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #425 – Black Science #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: On the cusp of his early 40s, Josh Flanagan joins Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery to talk about the comics. It was a big week, but the boys manage to discuss everything. All of the comics. Plus, Conor's captainship and Paul's curious fixation on sinuses stand revealed.

episodes.title: iFanboy’s Booksplode #14 - Akira, vols. 3 and 4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul Montgomery and Skottie Young continue their their brain-popping journey through Katsuhiro Otomo's landmark (toppling) Akira saga with volumes 3 and 4. In the 21st century, the glittering Neo-Tokyo has risen from the rubble of a Tokyo destroyed by an apocalyptic telekinetic blast from a young boy called Akira -- the subject of a covert government experiment gone wrong now imprisoned in frozen stasis. But Tetsuo, an angry young man with immense and rapidly growing psychic abilities, has done the unthinkable: he has released Akira and set into motion a chain of events that could once destroy the city and drag the world to the brink of Armageddon. Resistance agents and an armada of government forces race against the clock to find the child with godlike powers before his unthinkable destructive abilities are unleashed! Running Time: 01:03:06 Music: "Mr. Twist" SS

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #424 – Daredevil #36
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: No lovelife talk this week. Just comics, and only comics take over, as we get in deep with an excellent week of sequentials and raccoon based cinema.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #423 – She-Hulk #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Love is in the air! It's time to celebrate Valentine's Day, and the call went out to the audience for their questions about love and boy, did they deliver! Also, there were comics this week and an abundance of great ones! Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Paul Montgomery love each and every one of you equally.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #422 – Minimum Wage #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor, ever absent, has left us this episode, and so we invited Jim Viscardi of the Let's Talk Comics podcast to fill in, and so he did, which apparently caused Josh to just ramble on and on and on. We still can't be sure how to say Mitch Gerads' name, and that's just gonna have to be OK.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition Podcast - ‘Justice League: War’
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Vic-to-ry! Vic-to-ry! The iFanboy Animation Brain Trust assembles once more! Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt set aside their differences to suss out Justice League: War, the latest direct-to-video feature from DC Animation, and the first in a line of New 52 adaptations. How well does Geoff Johns and Jim Lee's "Origin" story line translate to animation, and is this a strong pilot for the studio's future endeavors? Is Steve Trevor doomed to always finish last? Running Time: 00:39:04 Music: "Dark Side" Kelly Clarkson

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #421 – Thor: God of Thunder #18
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Here there be dragon! Scottish braves Paul Montgomery, Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan mix up their Gruber family tree while divulging a dubious understanding of their own shared heritage, all while yammering about the week's finest comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy’s Booksplode #13 - Akira vols. 1 and 2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: "TETSUO!" "KANEDA!" Paul Montgomery and special guest Skottie Young discuss the first two volumes in Katsuhiro Otomo's landmark manga saga Akira. “Welcome to Neo-Tokyo, built on the ashes of a Tokyo annihilated by a blast of unknown origin that triggered World War III. The lives of two streetwise teenage friends, Tetsuo and Kaneda, change forever when paranormal abilities begin to waken in Tetsuo, making him a target for a shadowy agency that will stop at nothing to prevent another catastrophe like the one that leveled Tokyo. At the core of the agency’s motivation is a raw, all-consuming fear of an unthinkable, monstrous power known only as Akira. Katsuhiro Otomo’s stunning science fiction masterpiece is considered by many to be the finest work of graphic fiction ever produced, and Otomo’s brilliant animated film version is regarded worldwide as a classic.” Running Time: 01:01:01 Music: "World War III" T.S.O.L.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #420 – All-New Invaders #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul Montgomery has returned to join Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan in discussing the week in comic books! Plus–just how cool of a lady was Martha Washington?

episodes.title: Talksplode #65 - Making Comics with Charles Soule and Joe Mulvey
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Look who’s back! Josh Flanagan comes out of Talksplode hiatus to speak with a couple of bona fide comic book creators about the process, mind, and lifestyle of the creator-owned comic book maker. From the mind of the artist, to the way to make it work with your life, to the challenges of the modern market, the conversation covers a ton of ground, and is a real insight to what it means to make comics. Charles Soule (Swamp Thing, Thunderbolts, Letter 44, Superman/Wonder Woman) has risen through the ranks of comic book writers over the last year to the point where he’s currently writing seven ongoing series, with a mix of DC, Marvel, and indie series. He’s a returning guest. You can find him on Twitter here. Joe Mulvey is the creator of Scam from ComixTribe, a writer and artist who is paving his own way through comics. He’s currently in the process of a Kickstarter campaign for the SCAM Ultimate Collection, featuring a short story written by Josh himself, as well as hundreds of pages of other content from a host of great names in comics. You can follow Joe on Twitter as well. Total Running Time: 01:29:09 Music: “Everything is Borrowed” The Streets

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #419 – B.P.R.D.: Hell on Earth – The Reign of the Black Flame #115
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Paul Montgomery out doing who knows what, old pal Jim Mroczkowski steps in to talk about the week in comic books with Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #418 – Afterlife with Archie #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Now that was a proper week of comics. We talk about the books of the week, only a bit of World War II, and Conor’s older friend. Also: Elephant stuff. Additionally, we run down some of the new series announced at ImageEXPO 2014, and have a Book of the Month that actually falls within the first half of said month. It is truly a New Year’s miracle!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #417 – The Flash #26
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: While the first week of the New Year didn't boast heaps of new comics, Josh, Conor and Paul missed each other too much to delay their reunion any further. Listen as they ring in 2014 with a few extra audience questions and a joyous dirge for a dearly departed series that took a bow over the break.

episodes.title: 2013 iFanboy All-Media Year End Round-Up
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s the eighth annual iFanboy All-Media Year End Round-Up! Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and special guest Mike Romo discuss everything they enjoyed in media in 2013. Movies, television, music, books, video games, and comics--it's all here!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #416 – Thunderbolts #19
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: We talk through a lot of great comics, run the Picks of the Week by the numbers, and then if you’re not a Band of Brothers fan, you might want to skip the end bit. We don’t recommend this course of action. It’s the last regular show of the year!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #415 – Action Comics #26
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: As the year winds down, Conor Kilparick, Josh Flanagan, and Paul Montgomery gather to talk the week of comics but to also hand out some year end awards!

episodes.title: iFanboy Booksplode #12 - Doctor Strange: The Oath
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Paul Montgomery and Timmy Wood stare, unblinking, into the Eye of Agamotto as they revisit 2007's Doctor Strange: The Oath by The Private Eye team of Brian K. Vaughan and Marcos Martin! Steven Strange has been struck by a silver bullet fired from the same accursed pistol Hitler used to end his life! Can the Night Nurse restore the Sorcerer Supreme to health? What's wrong with Wong? What are master and manservant willing to do to save the other's life? What's Night Nurse's overhead? Why isn't there more of this? All that and more on the latest thrilling installment of iFanboy's Booksplode! Total running time: 00:44:53 Music: "Crystal Ball" Styx

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #414 – Black Science #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Drunk on Thanksgiving tryptophan, Conor and Josh drive a relatively sober Paul to the brink of madness in a rundown of the week's best comics. It being the first of December, Paul also surprises his fellows with the new Book of the Month selection.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #413 – Harley Quinn #0
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Band of Brothers, Scooby-Doo, Friday Night Lights, drugs, and Conor’s sex comic! Also we go with the more traditional “talking about comics” routine. We do not get that guy’s name right, and we don’t know how to talk about color. So just a regular show.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #412 – The Superior Foes of Spider-Man #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: We’ve got a man down... but not out! In the midst of intense physical pain, Josh Flanagan mans up to join Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery to discuss the week in comic books! There might be narcotics involved. Those are fun!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #411 - Amazing X-Men #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: After the 5th week last week, comics are back this week, and we're here to talk about fun, and the culmination of Stan Lee's fantasy. Not that one. We're not even sick of talking about new, excellent Marvel #1 issues, so off we go. Josh will try very hard to get on topic, with little success.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition - 'Thor: The Dark World'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: To me, Mjölnir! For Asgard! Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery assemble to discuss Thor: The Dark World! How does the sequel stack up to Thor's thunderous big screen debut in 2011? There are laughs! There are tears! Dudes get hit in the face with hammers! All of that plus just what to make of that mid-credits sequence and what does it mean for the future of the Marvel Cinematic Universe? Total Running Time: 00:33:30 Music: “Apocryphon” The Sword

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #410 – Superior Spider-Man Team-Up Special #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The culmination of Mike Costa's "Arms of Doctor Octopus" caper takes the gold in a typically oddball fifth week of comics. Josh Flanagan, Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick wholeheartedly embrace that pick as well as November's Book of the Month selection, The Fifth Beatle, about the Fab Four's enigmatic manager Brian Epstein. All that and more on this week's furry little show.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #409 – Pretty Deadly #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It's another voluminous head of glorious comic book discussion as Paul Montgomery, Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick comb through the week's picks.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #408 – Zero #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Josh off possibly doing some primal screaming in the woods, Ali Colluccio steps up to the microphone to talk the week that was in comics with Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #407 – Three #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Mike Romo is here! Mike Romo is here! Paul took a powder this week, and we forge ahead, some of us broadcasting from a car in the garage, triggering grim deja vu. The comics were hot and the car kept getting hotter, but we've got books of the week, and most of them were #1 issues. We check in on some of the comics announced at New York Comicon as well, and weigh in well before it's wise. Also, we know it wasn't the best connection, but it gets better as you keep going. Our apologies. Also apologies to the British and Phish fans.

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #406 – All-New X-Men Special #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Something must be in the water, or maybe in the air, but whatever the reason, it's a meandering episode of the Pick of the Week Podcast as Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Paul Montgomery discuss the week that was in comic books, as well as the dangers of Times Square, the final season of The Wire, and the proper pronunciation of a certain New England fish.

episodes.title: Booksplode #11 - Paul Pope's Batman Year 100 with Special Guest Scott Snyder
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The year is 2039 and the fabled Batman has emerged from the shadows of history. Let loose the dogs, because things are about to Booksplode. Special guest Scott Snyder (Batman, The Wake, Superman Unchained) joins Paul Montgomery to discuss Paul Pope's criminally under-appreciated Batman: Year 100. Here, the man beneath the cowl is both mythic and utterly human, an enigmatic soul dedicated to a safeguarding tomorrow's Gotham. Why does Snyder rank the work as of his top five favorite Batman stories? How does it continue to influence his own work? All that and heaps more Batman. Total Running Time: 00:46:16 Music: "This Time Tomorrow" The Kinks

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #405 – Jupiter's Legacy #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: On this alarmingly sexy edition of the Pick of the Week Podcast, Josh Flanagan, Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery get all hot and bothered over a teetering tower of terrific comics books. Conor selects a (quite frankly) brutal bit of superhero deconstruction for the lead discussion. Later, the guys talk two potential television projects from DC Entertainment, then wander down memory lane to reminisce on their college era reading habits.

episodes.title: iFanboy Special Edition - 'Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The Marvel Studios Movie Universe expands to the small screen with the debut of Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.! Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick team-up to discuss the pilot episode--what worked and what didn't work? How was the cast? And what about Agent Coulson, who was last seen bleeding out on the floor of the S.H.I.E.L.D. helicarrier? All of that plus speculation on what we'll see in future episodes and how it will tie-in to the Marvel movies, and mutual admiration for flying cars! Total Running time: 00:29:16 Music: "Whatever Lola Wants (Lola Gets)" Sarah Vaughan

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #404 – Action Comics #23.3: Lex Luthor #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Wait, Josh Flanagan chose WHAT as the Pick of the Week? That was the reaction of Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick had when word came down from on high but that's okay--in a long term relationship it's important to keep surprising your partner(s). Also, the other comic books of the week and Josh finally makes Paul laugh!

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #403 - Deadpool #16
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh returns, and we stumble slightly less through this new era. Paul doesn't want to sound like he does, and let's talk about greater NYC area carpet commercials. Also, there are a lot of comics that need to get covered, and by gum, we cover them. Hey Lord Vader, can you take a picture for us?

episodes.title: iFanboy Pick of the Week #402 - Batman: Black and White #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: A new era unfolds, but much remains the same. Though Josh sounds suspiciously like Ryan Haupt this week, Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery soldier on with a discussion of the first issue of the returning Batman: Black and White anthology series, a host of villainous tie-ins, and some large scale happenings through time and space.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #401 - Batman/Superman #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:06:36 You're pretty much gonna be talking about what happens at the end, but before all of that, there's a lot of great comic book discussion. Also, Josh is laid low with a cold, and a deep sense of denial. If you like greek yogurt, you should probably skip this one. Also: the Junk Reading and threats!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #400 - Wonder Woman #23
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 02:47:50 iFanboy celebrates its 400th episode with an extra-sized all listener e-mail spectacular! We asked you, the iFanbase, to send us e-mails on any topic you wanted and boy did you deliver! Not only was it Paul Montgomery's first show whose recording was streamed live on the internet, but Josh Flanagan broadcast from his survivalist bunker, and Conor Kilpatrick drank giant beers.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #399 - Thor: God of Thunder #11
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:06:01 As Josh casts a spectral white glow across the sands of Cape Cod, special guest Mike Romo tags in, joining Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery to talk the best of the week in comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #398 - Quantum and Woody! #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 00:53:42 Conor Kilpatrick's back! Then he's gone again! Then he comes back to talk the week in comics with Josh Flanagan and Paul Montgomery. The show completely falls apart at the end, everyone loves stationary, and the audio quality on this one is rough and you're just going to have to deal with it!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #397 - Indestructible Hulk #11
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:05:06 With Conor off dispensing with a matter of grave national importance, special guest Jim Mroczkowski joins Paul Montgomery and Josh Flanagan for a discussion of this week's most captivating comics. Thinks get silly in a fashion that Graham Chapman would never tolerate.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition - 'Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Running time: 00:38:54 With a stalwart Conor lost in the time stream, the iFanboy Animation Brain Trust soldiers on, undaunted. Paul Montgomery, Chris Neseman and Ryan Haup look back on Geoff Johns and Andy Kubert's Flashpoint comic event and the animated feature is has now inspired. A polarizing visual style and ultra-violent tone make for a polarizing departure for the long-running DC Animated line, so should prospective viewers walk or run to join the Flash for his first starring role? Music: "Lightning Strikes" Lou Christie

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #396 - Batman/Superman #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:04:46 It can easily be said that this program contains more talk about Bill and Ted than any other podcast we’ve ever done. There’s also other stuff about comics, but at the end of the day, what are you really here for? We also have deep conversations about comic book art, and complain, just a bit more, about Man of Steel.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition - 'The Wolverine'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Running time: 00:58.54 Special guests Brett White (Matt and Brett Love Comics, CBR, MTV's Splash Page) and David Accampo (Fuzzy Typewriter, Sparrow and Crowe: The Demoniac of Los Angeles) join Paul Montgomery to talk ninjas and bone claws. Does The Wolverine fall prey to the same mistakes as 2009's X-Men Origins: Wolverine, or does director James Mangold bring honor to the troubled ronin? One way to find out, bub. Music: "Katana Groove" Tomoyasu Hotei

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #395 - Deadpool #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:01:01 Conor calls in live from San Diego Comic-Con, and despite a shaky connection, we forge onward, while Josh and Paul enter phases of advanced heat stroke. Plus there’s also a problem with Baja Fresh. 2/3 of us may never recover.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #394 - Justice League #22
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:04:41 In the midst of the heat and hectic July scheduling, Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Paul Montgomery are back together to talk comics! This week things get weird. We're sorry.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #393 - Satellite Sam #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:02:23 With Conor off returning the iFanboy Bell to its clandestine shrine, resident Man of Science Ryan Haupt joins Josh Flanagan and Paul Montgomery for this week's broadcast. This week, Josh provokes the Doctor Who fans, Ryan learns some production jargon, and Paul adopts a new catch phrase.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #392 - Fury MAX #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: A week in which the major comic book companies dumped an entire truck load of new comic books on our unsuspecting hosts can mean only one thing… it’s the return of THE BELL! Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Paul Montgomery tremble before its mighty wrath and so shall you!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Booksplode #10 - Superman: Birthright
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: In the wake of Zack Snyder's Man of Steel film, Paul Montgomery, Conor Kilpatrick and Mike Romo look back a decade to another Superman origin story. In 2003, Mark Waid and Leinil Yu modernized the American myth of Krypton's last son in Superman: Birthright. What's changed? What remains the same? And does anyone have any second thoughts about Man of Steel? Brace yourselves for another Booksplode! Music: "Superman" Barbara Streisand

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #391 - Indestructible Hulk #9
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It's finally happened. Josh Flanagan has run off and joined a biker gang. So stepping up to the mic to join Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery this week in his stead is Dave Accampo, Paul's co-host on the Fuzzy Typewriter podcast!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #390 - Thor: God of Thunder #9
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Three men of discerning taste--one of them in a stationary automobile--discuss the best and not quite best comic books of the week. Elsewhere, Bob Reynolds weeps.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - 'Man of Steel'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Josh Flanagan makes a rare special edition podcast appearance as he joins Conor Kilpatrick and Mike Romo to talk about Man of Steel! Does Zach Snyder, David Goyer, and Christopher Nolan's attempt to bring Superman into the modern world soar? Has Warner Bros. finally found success outside of Gotham City? Is everyone on the show exhausted?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #389 - Astro City #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It’s all about Kurt Busiek (rhymes with “music”) as the creator gets the double whammy, with both Pick of the Week and Book of the Month honors with one show. Has it ever happened before? Who has time to check. All we know is that Conor is hungry and really wants a bagel. Good comics await, and the temperatures are more moderate. That makes for a good show.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #388 - The Wake #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: The Mercury is through the roof up in this podcast (at least for 33.3% of the crew)! Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery and Josh Flanagan pant over the week's hottest comic book titles as one NCIS: Los Angeles star waxes poetic on mutated sharks. Dive in for the commentary, stick around for the heat crazies!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #387 - Daredevil #26
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
