episodes.summary: In week where one comic book really showed the rest how it's done, another one ended an epic run, and a third began an unwelcome crossover, Conor Kilpatrick worked blue, Josh Flanagan was sleepy, and Paul Montgomery espoused some... interesting ideas about population control.

episodes.title: Talksplode #64 - Glen Weldon of Superman: The Unauthorized Biography
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Seventy-five years ago, Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster ushered an orphan son of Krypton through the fields of Kansas and up, up and away to the height of popular acclaim. These days, you'd be hard pressed to find someone unaware of Superman or his mild-mannered counterpart Clark Kent, but NPR's Glen Weldon knows the character better than most. Thankfully, he's sharing history and insight in the pages of Superman: The Unauthorized Biography. We spoke with the author at length about the best and worst iterations of the storied hero, from comics to radio to film and even the Broadway stage. Music: “Superman March” John Williams

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #386 - Edgar Allen Poe's The Fall of the House of Usher #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: This week? This was not our kind of week. That’s not to say comics were bad, but we had to work to find the standouts. And yet, it wasn’t impossible. Still, by the end of the overlong episode, there were script problems, and mean things are said to each other. Forget it. We’re gonna go play Warcraft III.
tags: The Fall of the House of Usher

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - 'Star Trek Into Darkness'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: It's time to boldly go back where... well, where many have been before! Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Mike Romo have gathered to talk about Star Trek Into Darkness! Where did everyone's Star Trek fandom begin? How did the sequel stack up against the first film that they loved so much? What about the villain? Where can the story go in a third film? How does Robocop fit into all of this? It's a wide-ranging discussion that covers A LOT of ground!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #385 - Thor: God of Thunder #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Total Running Time: 01:04:19 The three iFanboys reunite to herald the coming of space sharks! This week, Paul Montgomery, Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick sail the solar winds from the ruined shores of future Asgard to the interior of Deadpool's head and the tumult of modern Riverdale!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - 'Superman: Unbound'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: With Professor Ryan Haupt once again M.I.A. due to important matters of science, 75% of the iFanboy Animation Brain Trust reconvenes to discuss returns to discuss the latest from the DC Universe Animated Original Movies line: Superman: Unbound! It’s the first film not produced by Bruce Timm, and one that Warner Bros. hopes will capitalize on the buzz around Man of Steel, this summer’s live action return to the screen for Superman. Is it successful? Is it fun? Is it really a Supergirl and Lois Lane movie? Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Chris Neseman talk it out. Plus! We look ahead to Justice League: The Flashpoint Paradox, return to discussing the uncertain future of the line, and wonder if there could possibly be any stories from The New 52 that could receive the animated treatment? (Spoiler alert: Not many.)

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #384 - Animal Man #20
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Ryan Haupt Week concludes as he steps in for an absent Josh Flanagan to talk the week that was in comics alongside Paul Montgomery and a sleepy Conor Kilpatrick!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - 'Iron Man 3'
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Hold on to your giant plush rabbits and watch out for that underwater rebar! It's time to talk about Iron Man 3! Join Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery and Scientist Supreme Ryan Haupt for a spoiler-laden examination of all things Extremis and 1999 party playlists! Does Marvel Studios' first post-Avengers outing succeed? Does incoming director Shane Black capably step into armor once tailored to Jon Favreau? Just who is Trevor Slattery? And is it worth sticking around past the credits? Find out in the latest iFanboy Special Edition Podcast!

episodes.title: Booksplode #9 - Mind MGMT, Vol 01: The Manager
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Who is Henry Lyme? Join Paul Montgomery and Scientist Supreme Ryan Haupt as they bend spoons in an effort to unravel the mysteries of Matt Kindt's Mind MGMT! Why did the passengers and crew of Flight 815 (no, not that Flight 815) lose their memories up there in the clouds? What's up with Ewan McGregor's accent in 2009's Men Who Stare at Goats? What does heterochromia mean? What other easter eggs lay hidden throughout this, our May 2013 Book of the Month?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #383 - Uncanny Avengers #7
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: That's more like it! Comics delivered a whole bunch of great comics this week, some new and some old. Listen to the show, won't you, and try to keep us in Ferraris!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #382 - Captain Marvel #12
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Awash in a sea of alarmingly lackluster week of comics, Paul Montgomery, Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick discover that the cream truly does rise to the top.

episodes.title: Booksplode #8 - The Dark Knight Strikes Again
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Booksplode strikes back with a vengeance as Paul Montgomery, Josh Flanagan and Jeff Reid dissect the Dadaist oddity that is Frank Miller and Lynn Varley's The Dark Knight Strikes Again. Published 15 years after the landmark mini-series The Dark Knight Returns, this three-issue sequel was a notorious departure in form and lucidity. We're not going to claim to understand it entirely, but one of us with glasses might hail it one of the best and most important works of all time. It's Josh. He kind of says that.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #381 - Batman #19
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Hey, you hosers, listen up! The gangs all back together, eh, as Conor Kilpatrick returns to talk about comics with those two knobs, Paul Montgomery and Josh Flanagan. Beauty, eh?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #380 - Indestructible Hulk #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: We’ve got a case of Loikamania, as podcast host, and all around beloved comics figure, Pat Loika fills in for Conor Kilpatrick. There’s, well, there’s a lot of Marvel talk this week. It couldn’t be avoided. Also, did you know that Josh very, very old? He is. Will Pat ever return? Will Paul graduate to middle school? Who joined X-Face Scott? None of these questions are answered!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #379 - East of West #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Though he claimed last week he wouldn't be here, Conor Kilpatrick braves Death, War, Conquest and Famine to talk comics with fellow desperadoes Paul Montgomery and Josh Flanagan. This week, Paul pauses Bioshock Infinite just long enough to name a pale horse in the Pick of the Week race and make some dubious suggestions about iFanboy guerrilla marketing. Meanwhile, Conor sees Hitlers were there aren't any and Josh remains fixated on the anachronism of the stop/pause conundrum.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #378 - The Private Eye #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Conor Kilpatrick has returned from his meandering jaunt through the land of gators to talk the week that was in comics with Josh Flanagan and Paul Montgomery! This week, Josh decides who his favorite comics writer is, Paul realizes that he's getting older, and more secrets from Conor's double life are revealed!

episodes.title: Booksplode #7 - Planet Hulk
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Booksplode makes its SMASHING return as Paul Montgomery, Jim Mroczkowski, Ryan Haupt and Timmy Wood swear a war-bond and discuss Greg Pak's Planet Hulk story line. Where was Bruce Banner during the events of Marvel's Civil War? Why was he so ticked when he turned up again in its fallout?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #377 - Avengers Arena #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 17, 2013 - This show is out on St. Patrick's Day, and yet there are no references at all. In fact, we're down one Kilpatrick! Jim Mroczkowski, our intrepid columnist fills in ably, and Paul starts off with a twang. There are things liked, and things unliked, and reasons given for nearly all of it. No children, fictional or otherwise, were harmed in the recording of this episode.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #376 - Sex #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 10, 2013 - It's your weekly dose of hot and sweaty threeway comic book talk! On this episode, Josh Flanagan has his sense of identity crushed, Conor Kilpatrick commits an embarrassing 80s cartoon error, and Paul Montgomery makes a startling admission in the final seconds of the show!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #375 - Batman, Incorporated #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 3, 2013 - Josh has stopped coughing, and a fictional character has stopped fictionally breathing. Plus we question Paul's choices of 80s sci-fi film. Then Josh questions Conor, and Conor questions right back. Listen, it's all very complicated, but you'll be able to hear everyone, so that's something.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #374 - Hellblazer #300
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 24, 2013 - An appropriately cough-addled Josh Flanagan stirs the ashes with his Pick of the Week, the finale to a series he's enjoyed consistently for over a decade. He's joined by Paul Montgomery and Conor Kilpatrick to discuss highlights from the rest of the week's books, including wreathed goats, cats in vacuums and both good and bad vibrations.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #373 - Batman #17
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 17, 2013 – In an unusual week of comic books, Paul Montgomery chooses an under-the-radar release as his very first Pick of the Week. He then joins Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick in discussing the highlights from rest of this week’s comics as well as pianos, classic comic strips, and the marketing virtues of vandalism.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #372 - Green Arrow #17
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 10, 2013 – Listen up, maggots! This week Conor Kilpatrick and Paul Montgomery talk comics while Josh Flanagan adopts a new hard-nosed personality. It’s a little off-putting and frankly, inappropriate. Also, the age old question is answered: just how delicious are donuts? (A lot).

episodes.title: Talksplode #62 with Charles Soule of Swamp Thing and Strange Attractors
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Charles Soule is set to have a busy 2013. Starting in April, he’s the new ongoing writer of Swamp Thing following Scott Snyder’s exit from the title. We talk about how the opportunity came about, how he’s approached the project, and his trip down to Louisiana to really understand where the character is from.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #371 – Punisher War Zone #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 3, 2013 – It’s all new, but it’s just the same. Josh and Conor are joined by their new permanent co-host, who has brought more television metaphors than any same man would know what to do with. We all read and talk about a lot of Punisher, and are thrown off by all the changes Paul brings in with his clipboard and red pen. Boss Nass is the first thing to go.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Part Two
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 31, 2013 - With Professor Haupt off performing meatball surgery in a dubious tenement, 75% of the iFanboy Animation Brain Trust returns for the second half of Warner Bros.’ Batman: The Dark Knight Returns. Boasting two of the most savage and iconic death matches in comic history, this is likely the pinnacle of ambition for Timm and his team. You might be shocked at just much survived the translation from page to screen, from swastika bosoms to Dutch himself, but just how important is that faithful hand? As with the first half, Conor, Paul and Chris are somewhat divided in their verdict, but some opinions just may actually have shifted in the intermission. Plus! Just how terrifying is Michael Emerson’s Joker? Should Clark button up that blouse when handling bald eagles? Just how stoked are we for upcoming outings Superman: Unbound and Flashpoint? What iconic stories remain untapped but deserving of the animated treatment?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #370 - Young Avengers #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 27, 2013 – It’s Ron’s last Pick of the Week podcast as he makes his exit from iFanboy to go to the publishing side of comics at Image Comics, so the guys thought it would be a good time to a live broadcast of the podcast. And you know what that means? Extra long podcast filled with booze, some arguing and a little bit of emotion. You’ll want to listen to this whole thing as it’s filled with that entertaining bit that iFanboy has brought you for the past 7 years. Oh, and stick with it through the end for some added bonus material.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #369 - Batman #16
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 20, 2013 – A cloud looms overhead as this marks Ron’s second to last pick of the week podcast, but that doesn’t stop Josh, Conor and Ron from talking the mastery of Batman and the other great comics that came out this week and other interesting bits of discussion. Most importantly, we get cameos from both Michael Caine and Eddie Vedder.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #368 - Star Wars #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 13, 2013 – “A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away–” “WHAT?!” “A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away, Ron Richards, Josh Flanagan, and Conor Kilpatrick sat down to ta–” “WHAT?!” “I said, a long time ago in a galaxy far, far away, Ron Richards, Josh Flanagan, and Conor Kilpatrick sat down to talk about the week in comics, as well as oth–” “WHAT?!” “Sigh.”

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #367 - All-New X-Men #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 6, 2013 – It’s the first podcast of the year and the guys are a little but rusty, but they get their act together in time to deliver a stellar entry into the new year along with BONUS material at the end of the show. Happy New Year!

episodes.title: 2012 iFanboy All-Media Year End Round-Up
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 30, 2012 – It’s the seventh annual iFanboy All-Media Year End Round-Up! Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick discuss everything they enjoyed in media in 2012. Movies, television, books, podcasts, music, video games, and comics–it’s all here!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #366 - Hawkeye #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 23, 2012 – It’s the last pick of the week podcast for 2012 and Josh, Conor and Ron go out with a bang, with a celebration of what’s new in comics, a discussion of double shipping, and a flashback to past math based entertainment. ‘Tis the season!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #365 - Conan The Barbarian #11
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 12, 2012 – The holidays are coming and Josh, Conor and Ron are starting to get in the mood to celebrate Bing Crosby and the insanity of Wolverine’s personal life.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #364 - Avengers #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 9, 2012 – It’s two against one as Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick share a microphone and Josh Flanagan is left all by his lonesome to wonder if they are rolling his eyes when he talks (they are).

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #363 - Before Watchmen: Silk Spectre #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 2, 2012 – The gang’s back together for the start of December as Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards gather to discuss the week that was in comics… and perhaps also 80s toy makers, Goodfellas, and the iFanboy staffer that’s on thin ice.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #362 - Baltimore: The Play
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 25, 2012 – It’s a special Thanksgiving holiday edition of the Pick of the Week Podcast. That means that Conor is MIA, navigating numerous Thanksgiving deliciousness, so Josh and Ron are left to carry the banner on this holiday. And what better way to kick things off than to hear about Josh’s enjoyment of Baltimore: The Play from Dark Horse Comics. We breakdown the recent Marvel NOW! releases, as well as Ron (And the iFanbase’s) choice for pick, Amazing Spider-Man #698. Alas, no show notes this week as we’re taking a weekend to ourselves. Hope everyone had a great holiday weekend in the US and a general good weekend around the world! Music: It’s The Most Wonderful Time Of Year Andy Williams

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #361 - Thor: God of Thunder #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 18, 2012 – Just before departing to join the absent Conor for the most Eisner-iffic wedding celebration ever, Ron managed to record a show with Josh and our own Paul Montgomery. The one clear thing about this week is that there were a lot of good books, and Ron was forced to choose one. We may have also spent a lot of time just prior to the show talking about original music from Return of the Jedi and a great deal of minutiae to that end.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #360 - Deadpool #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 11, 2012 – Josh finds out what it means to be a comic book fan as he deals with the cancellation and relaunching of his favorite ongoing series. Sure, we talk about the comics that came out this week including Josh’s pick of the week, but let’s be honest, his meltdown at the end of the show is all we’re really interested in

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #359 - Joe Kubert Presents #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 4, 2012 – With the spectre of Hurricane Sandy hanging over everything, Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, and Josh Flanagan reconvene to discuss the week in comics which includes a few anthologies and an original graphic novel!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #358 - Captain America #19
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 28, 2012 – It’s just one long last day at summer camp as Ron Richards, Josh Flanagan, and Conor Kilpatrick say goodbye to storied Marvel Comics runs over, over, and over again. Plus the mystery of Giuseppe Camuncoli is explored! Also, barrels.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #357 - Before Watchmen: Minutemen #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 21, 2012 – Ron Richards, Josh Flanagan, and Conor Kilpatrick have returned to their normal routines following the New York Comic Con. But are they changed? Forever? And what sway does that Chris Ware page have over Josh, and how far will it go? All these questions aren’t answered, and more, in this week’s strange presentation.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #356 - Uncanny Avengers #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 14, 2012 – It’s the last comic con of 2012, and Josh Flanagan, Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards are back in a hotel room, gathered around the mic to talk about this week’s comics. Specifically, to address just what Ron was thinking making Uncanny Avengers #1 the pick of the week and not Batman #13. We also talk about a bunch of the week’s other releases, but due to the con and being exhausted, no detailed show notes for this episode.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #355 - Legends of the Dark Knight #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 7, 2012 – Ron Richards, Josh Flanagan, and Conor Kilpatrick gather together to talk comics one more time before heading to the Big Apple for New York Comic Con. But the real question on everyone’s mind is: will you pick me up at the airport?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #354 - Fury MAX #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 30, 2012 - What does a yellow light mean? Ron is doing something with a bald man, and Paul Montgomery joins in to fill the void. There are many reasonable disagreements and quite a bit of mutual praise. We all like Preacher for example, which is perfect, given the Pick of the Week. Future episodes might have a lot of random typewriter noises, so enjoy this relatively quiet one while you can.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Part One
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 27, 2012 - It’s been three months since the iFanboy Animation Braintrust has been seen stalking the streets of iFanboy, and in that time their myth has only grown. Now, in the time of iFanboy’s greatest need, Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, Ryan Haupt, and Paul Montgomery have shaved their mustaches and returned to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie, Batman: The Dark Knight Returns, Part One!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #353 - The Li'L Depressed Boy #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 23, 2012 – Richard Milhouse Nixon. Much has been written about America’s 37th President, but what do we really know about him? Find out this week as iFanboy unveils the new history-centric format of the Pick of the Week Podcast. And, oh yes, comics are discussed as well.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Dredd 3-D
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 23, 2012 - Citizens: The Mega Block community designated "Peach Trees" is under siege. Drug boss Madelaine "Ma-Ma" Madrigal has staged a coup, locking down the entire 200-story complex. She has promised to raise the blast doors only after investigating Judges Dredd and Anderson are summarily executed. Join the extraction team of Judge Ron Richards, Judge Conor Kilpatrick, and hot-shot provisional Judge Paul "Red Beard" Montgomery as they brave a hail of 3D gunfire and experiment with the mind-altering street drug known as "Slo-Mo." All rise for the final judgement of the year's last feature-length comic book adaptation, Dredd 3D!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #352 - The Rocketeer: Cargo of Doom #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 16, 2012 – Watch as Josh’s cold goes from bad to worse as the episode progresses, but that doesn’t stop him! No! Josh waits patiently as Ron overreacts to the events of Avengers Vs. X-Men #11 and Conor grows more and more impatient as the rant continues. But luckily, the purity and joy of The Rocketeer has come to save us all. Except Josh, who is dying. (Not really, it’s just a cold)

episodes.title: Talksplode #61 – Geek Nation Tours with Teras Cassidy
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: If you’re looking for a fun new way to approach your vacation with a geek slant, then you’ll be interested to hear what Teras Cassidy and Geek Nation Tours has to offer.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #351 - Hawkeye #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 9, 2012 – After the haze and delirium of episode #350, the guys are back to the regular show, and Ron’s got his letter writing hat and something to say! We can say that there are a lot of comics to talk about, and in some of those comics, there are a lot of genitals. Sit in, and find the secret of Conor’s full name. Also: Michael Bolton and Kenny G! “This will not stand!”

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #350 - Prophet #28 plus YOUR Questions
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: iFanboy celebrates its 350th episode with a triple-sized all listener e-mail spectacular! We asked you, the iFanbase, to send us e-mails on any topic you wanted and boy did you deliver! Not only did we break out the booze to go along with the email but we also streamed the recording live on the internet. It was madness, we tell you. Madness.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #349 - Scalped #60
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 26, 2012 – With Josh Flanagan possibly dead on a mountain bike trail somewhere in the northeast, Paul Montgomery returns begrudgingly to the mic to join Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick to discuss the dueling picks of the week, as we honor the end of a legacy and the continuation of another.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #348 - Saga #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 19, 2012 – It’s iFanboy in the Morning! With a groggy Conor and Ron, Josh extolls the virtue of near comics perfection with both the pick of the week and the book of the month. It’s so much good comics, that we’re running out of adjectives. PLUS – Conor put Ron out to to dry in advance of the impending 350!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #347 - Spider-Men #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 12, 2012 – With Ron Richards somewhere up in the clouds, the internet’s Paul Montgomery steps in to join Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan to talk comics, adult video storage, and beards.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #346 – Black Kiss II #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 5, 2012 – The original iFanboy Trilogy is back in full effect. Then things get dirty really fast, but that’s because of a dirty, dirty POW.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #345 – B.P.R.D. Hell on Earth: Exorcism #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 29, 2012 – Ron and Conor are gone. They’re just gone. Josh brings in Paul Montgomery and Timmy Wood from the iFanboy.com staff, and we trudge forward bravely. By the end, we’ve come up with a sit-com based on the Falcon. So it went fine, clearly. There was some Jar Jar.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #344 - Batman Beyond Unlimited #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 22, 2012 -Thanks to the double combination of recovering from the San Diego Comic-Con and the late night Dark Knight movie experience, Josh, Conor and Ron are overtired and a bit punchy, but you know that’s just when things get interesting and a bit wacky.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - The Dark Knight Rises
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 22, 2012 - Christopher Nolan’s epic Batman trilogy comes to an end with The Dark Knight Rises!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #343 - The Walking Dead #100
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 15, 2012 – It’s that time again, time for the San Diego Comic-Con. Coming at you sorta live, from our hotel room in San Diego, Ron, Josh and Conor struggle to keep their voices and tell you about some of the comics they read this week as well as some quick reflection from the con. Unfortunately, no time for show notes this week but that gives you more reason to listen to hear what’s discussed!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #342 - Fury MAX #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 8, 2012 – I am Adam, Prince of Eternia, Defender of the Secrets of Castle Greyskull. This is Kringer, my fearless friend. Fabulous, secret powers were revealed to me the day I held aloft my magic sword and said: “By the Power of Greyskull! … I have the comics!” Kringer became the mighty BattleCat and I became He-Man, the most powerful man in the Universe! Only three others share this secret… Our friends Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards. Together we defend Castle Greyskull from the evil forces of Skeletor!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - The Amazing Spider-Man
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 8, 2012 - You may not have understood why Sony rebooted the franchise so soon, but regardless, The Amazing Spider-Man starring Andrew Garfield and Emma Stone was released nationwide this past week. A new origin, mechanical webshooters, a new uniform and a new rogue in The Lizard give Josh, Conor and Ron enough to talk about. Stay gold, Ponyboy. Check out the full discussion on The Amazing Spider-Man as well as Paul Montgomery’s review of the movie. Music: No Way Down The Shins

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #341 - Scalped #69
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 1, 2012 – Summertime is here. The heat is rising and having it’s affect on the podcast as tensions are high. Listen, it’s a thing. Also San Diego looms as does script sabotage, but nothing will stop Josh Flanagan, Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards from talking comics. Well maybe not nothing, rebar would stop us for sure.

episodes.title: Talksplode #60 – Jamie S. Rich and Mike Norton of It-Girl
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Looking for a new super hero comic with a strong female lead? It-Girl from Image Comics may be the one you’re looking for. Writer Jamie S. Rich and artist Mike Norton come together to further the adventures of It-Girl, who you may know as a Mike Allred creation from the Madman universe. In this edition of Talksplode, we chat with Jamie S. Rich and Mike Norton about the project, how it came to be, what we can expect from it and what it’s like to work on a character from one of comics’ greats, Mike Allred. Music: Jet Girl The Wedding Present

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #340 - Saga #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 24, 2012 – Guess what? It’s HOT again! Ron Richards, Conor, Kilpatrick, and Josh Flanagan cover a lot of ground, and even manage to escape without heatstroke. Good books, bad books, and some stuff that just doesn’t make any sense, as the show goes off script, and then back on, awaits the listener!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #339 - Batman #10
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 17, 2012 – You know, Josh Flanagan, Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards have been thinking about comics lately. And I mean REALLY thinking about comics, like for hours. Just, you know, mulling over comics and what they could be. Like realllllly thinking about them…. t

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Superman vs. The Elite
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 17, 2012 - The call has gone out and the iFanboy Animation Brain Squad has reconvened to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie, Superman vs. The Elite. What was the comic book climate that lead to this story of Superman taking on new and edgy superheroes? And does the adaptation live up to what many call the best single issue Superman comic book of all time? Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, Chris Neseman, and Ryan Haupt have some thoughts. Plus! It’s time to express some hopes, fears, and doubts about the next film: Batman: The Dark Knight Returns – Part One! And Paul reveals a deep dark secret.

episodes.title: iFanboy Talksplode #58 – John Layman on Chew, Secret Agent Poyo and more!
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Chew has been a long running top quality book and a favorite at the iFanboy offices. We caught up with writer John Layman to discuss why they're re-printing Chew #27, which was released out of order a year ago, and what fans can expect from this second printing aside from a different cover. We also discuss what the creative process on Chew is as Layman works with creative partner Rob Guillory and get some insight into how an issue of Chew comes together. AND Layman makes a stunning prediction about an upcoming issue of Chew and the iFanboy Pick of the Week. In addition to Chew #27, we take the opportunity to talk about the phenomenon of Secret Agent Poyo and what we can expect from the upcoming oneshot. Layman describes the Secret Agent Poyo as his Amy Racecar, the oneshots that David Lapham used to do in the Stray Bullets universe. In addition to Chew and Secret Agent Poyo, Layman fills us in on some of his other upcoming work, including a project with artist Sam Kieth. Music: "Bucket of Chicken" Sunny Day Real Estate

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #338 - Fury MAX #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 10, 2012 – We need to have a talk about flippancy on this week’s podcast as Josh Flanagan is joined by Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards for yet another chapter in the ongoing tale of the pick of the week podcast, filled with bias. GO SCREW!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Prometheus
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 10, 2012 - In space no one can hear you… podcast? One of the most anticipated films of 2012 is finally here: Prometheus! It’s director Ridley Scott’s prequel to his 1979 sci-fi classic Aliens, and reactions have certainly been mixed. Join Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Mike Romo as they attempt to suss out what went right and what went wrong.

episodes.title: iFanboy Talksplode #57 - Greg Rucka
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Just such a nightmare is chronicled in Mulholland Book’s Alpha, the first in a series of Jad Bell novels by master tactician Greg Rucka. Paul joins Greg Rucka on a free-wheeling tour of WilsonVille, the fictitious theme park at the center of this tremendous thriller.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #337 – America’s Got Powers #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 03, 2012 – Ron Richards returns and promptly Josh Flanagan disappears so Ron and Conor Kilpatrick are joined by the Internet’s Paul Montgomery as the deftly avoid the news of the day to break it down on this week’s comic books during a dreaded 5th week, which seems like some sort of time paradox.

episodes.title: iFanboy Talksplode #56 - Chris Schweizer and Scott Chantler
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: We’ve got a special Talksplode for you today, featuring two fantastic cartoonist/graphic novelists, talking about their career and making comics, and doing all ages and historical comics.Chris Schweizer is the creator of the Crogan’s series of books, and the recent third volume, Crogan’s Loyalty about a branch of the Crogan family during the American Revolutionary War. Scott Chantler is a Canadian writer and artist with a fantastic body of work from Northwest Passage to Two Generals to the Three Thieves series of all-ages adventure books, as well as others.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #336 - Cobra #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 27, 2012 – A technical SNAFU cripples Conor Kilpatrick’s microphone… Ron Richards has gone mysteriously missing… who will step in to save the day and join Conor and Josh Flanagan to talk about the week that was in comic books? Super scientist Ryan Haupt to the rescue!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Tim Seeley of REVIVAL, WITCHBLADE, EXSANGUINE, and BLOODSTRIKE
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 24, 2012 - Tim Seeley has made a name for himself in comics in a very different way than a lot of creators. Starting off at Devil’s Due, he made a big impact with Hack/Slash, his creator owned ode to slasher movies, showing the way for genre diversification in comics. At the same time, he can work as a writer, artist, or both, and has around plenty of Marvel and DC books. These days, Seeley can be found writing a whole bunch of books. Hack/Slash continues monthly from Image Comics, as will the mystery Revival with his friend and collaborator Mike Norton. Meanwhile, Tim has taken over as the regular writer on Witchblade for Top Cow, and with what time is left over he’s co-created and drawing Exsanguine for Dark Horse with Josh Emmons. Oh yeah, and he’s also writing Bloodstrike for the relaunched Extreme line of Rob Liefeld comics. It’s a lot.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #335 - Fantastic Four #605.1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 20, 2012 – Once again, Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, and Josh Flanagan gather to talk about the week in com– OHMYGOD! IT’S THE BELL! SCATTER! FLEE! RUN FOR YOUR LIVES!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Independent Voices in Comics
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 18, 2012 - This past Monday, Earth-2 Comics in Northridge, CA hosted “Independent Voices in Comics: New Stories and How To Sell Them”, a panel discussion about the current state of independent comics, moderated by Conor Kilpatrick of iFanboy. Topics included the work that must be done after making your comic book, the difficulty in getting distribution, the importance of owning your own ideas, the retail perspective on independent comics, and… Dunkin Donuts in Los Angeles? The panelists included: Jim McCann – The Return of the Dapper Men (Archaia), Mind The Gap (Image Comics) Dave Accampo and Jeremy Rogers – Sparrow and Crowe: The Demoniac of Los Angeles (Hermes Press) Ed LaRoche – Almighty and Waveform (Self-Published) Darren Thomas – Manager of Earth-2 Comics (Northridge)

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #334 - Uncanny X-Force #25
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 13, 2012 – We admit we’re at a little bit of a loss to explain this one, and if you didn’t watch the Real World Seattle in 1998, you might get a little lost too, but what you need to know is that we think it’s very funny, and we can’t help ourselves. Besides that, we promise we actually talk about comics too, and look, it went longer than normal. WE’RE GIVING YOU EVERYTHING!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #333 - Daredevil #12
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 6, 2012 – Mark it in the books! The first podcast of 2012 to include a complaint about the heat! You’ll have to guess who’s complaining though as Josh, Conor and Ron gather on the eve of the Avengers movie opening to talk about this week’s comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Marvel's The Avengers
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 6, 2012 - And there came a day, a day unlike any other, when Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick found themselves united to talk about the most anticipated film of the summer. On that day, iFanboy was born—to talk about the films no single ordinary podcast could withstand! Through the years, their roster has prospered, changing many times, but their glory has never been denied! Heed the call, then—for now, the iFanboys Assemble! Music: “Not Alone Anymore” The Traveling Wilburys

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #332 - Daredevil #11
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 29, 2012 – Gather ’round, kids, as Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards talk the week in comics, Ron’s inability to say certain words in a non-sexy way, and general comic book fatigue. Pew! Pew! Stormtroopers are hitting the floor all over this one!

episodes.title: Talksplode #54 - Sean Murphy of Punk Rock Jesus, American Vampire, and Joe the Barbarian
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 26, 2012 - Sean Murphy has been kicking around comics for quite a while, but it was really in 2010 that he came to prominence, as the artist for Joe the Barbarian, written by Grant Morrison. He followed that up with Hellblazer and American Vampire miniseries, and is now poised to release his 6 issue Punk Rock Jesus, which he both wrote and drew.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #331 - The Manhattan Projects #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 22, 2012 – Trading Places? Freaky Friday? NO! It’s the weekly breakdown between Josh, Conor and Ron of this week’s comics. New ideas, classic action, tributes and good comics done right. Damn, it’s good to be a comic fan.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #330 - Saga #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 15, 2012 – Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards return to the show just in time to go from the wheelhouse to the sphere of excitement. Also, SECRETS, a legacy of beards, and a surprise cameo!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #329 - Avengers Vs. X-Men #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 8, 2012 – It’s the annual iFanboy.com Staff Writer show! With Ron, Josh and Conor off stuffing their faces with Cadbury eggs, Ryan Haupt, Mike Romo, Ali Colluccio and Jim Mroczkowski step in to discuss the week’s comics! Plus, a very special announcement for loyal iFanboy listener SSG Jonathan Castillo. Mrs. Castillo has asked as to relay whether their forthcoming baby is an iFanboy or iFangirl, and we’re pleased to oblige. Place your bets now!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #328 - FF #16
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 1, 2012 – Ron is back! Just before he heads out of town again for Emerald City Comic-Con in Seattle! But in the meantime, we manage to fill the time with talk about comic books and the spoiler of talking about those comic books, and how the book spoils itself when read. There’s no escape.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #327 – John Carter: The Gods of Mars #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 25, 2012 – With Ron Richards on a plane somewhere overhead, Paul Montgomery steps in to join Josh Flanagan and Conor Kilpatrick to chat about the week of comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #326 - Saga #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 18, 2012 – The return of one of comics’ best writers is cause for celebration and discussion as Conor KIlpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards pour over the week that was in comic books. Also! The fall of Unsolved Mysteries and the best way to drive from New York City to Ithaca.

episodes.title: Talksplode #52 – Justice For Hire Part 2 with Neal Adams and John Machado
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 16, 2012 - On this follow up edition of of iFanboy Talksplode, we talk with some more of the folks behind the Justice For Hire comics and the Justice For Hire Free for All Event.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #325 - Swamp Thing #7
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 11, 2012 – Rebar and Symbotay are the words of the day, and also the two completely unexpected tangents we travel on. One is terrifying, and t’other makes no sense t’all.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - John Carter
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 11, 2012 - Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ali Colluccio gather together for this special edition podcast to discuss everything John Carter

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #324 – Invincible #89
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 4, 2012 – Sometimes, “it was a good book” is all you can manage, and that’s cool. Sometimes. This week, we go through the books, and say what was right about a lot of them, and what was wrong with the rest. We have some character growth as well, which helps our individual arcs.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Justice League: Doom
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 1, 2012 -The iFanboy Animation Braintrust–Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, Chris Neseman, and Ryan Haupt–has reconvened to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie, Justice League: Doom. How does the adaptation of Mark Waid and Howard Porter’s 12 year old “Tower of Babel” storyline from JLA stand up to the other Justice League movies in the series? Opinions are mixed. Plus! The Braintrust talks about the legacy of Dwayne McDuffie, the elevation of Cyborg, and how the animated redesigns trump those in the New 52.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #323 - Fantastic Four #603
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 26, 2012 – With Ron Richards off covering Image Expo 2012, Paul Montgomery steps in to join Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan to talk all things comics… and all things nautical? Also, who is this Tim Drake person that everyone keeps going on about?

episodes.title: Talksplode #51- Justice for Hire
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 23, 2012 - On this edition of iFanboy Talksplode, we chat with the folks behind the Justice For Hire comics and the Justice For Hire Free for All Event. Justice for Hire is an exciting, independent comic book combining the world of mixed martial arts with action comic books. We chatted with Justice For Hire creators Jan Lucanus and Jan C. Childress, a father and son writing duo. Jan Lucanus is director, co-creator and co-writer of Justice For Hire and his father, Jan C. Childress has a long history of working in comics, most notably with Jim Shooter in the 1990s. In addition we chat with Zach Shelton, the Justice For Hire Lead Animator and Founder of Willow Road Animation and John Martin, a VP at Reallusion, the company behind the animation program Crazy Talk. You can read Justice for Hire #0 for free at Graphicly And find out about the Justice For Hire Free for All Event where you can enter your animation and be judged by Neal Adams, Ahmed Best and other celebrity judges! Full details available on the Justice for Hire Facebook page!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #322 - Peter Panzerfaust #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 19, 2012 – It’s a comic book jamboree this week as we wonder what’s the deal with all the moloids and other burning questions about the world of comics, like how many point one issues can one publisher print?. And other hits including: Always provide a glossary, bonus points for maps and building cutaways, and Josh’s love for greek mythology.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 19, 2012 - Who would be brave (or foolish) enough to head to the multiplex to endure Ghost Rider: Spirit of Vengeance? Who would endure the sequel to that awful 2007 movie starring Nick Cage? Who would weather a 90 minute cinematic penance stare and then come back and tell the world about it? Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick, that’s who. iFanboy: Seeing The Movies So You Don’t Have To. Music: (Ghost) Riders in the Sky Johnny Cash

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #321 - Punisher MAX #22
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 12, 2012 – It’s an extended edition of the podcast this week as Josh, Conor and Ron dive deep into the turbulent waters of comics this week. From the grizzly end of The Punisher MAX with issue #22 to the crisis of faith in collecting comics. It’s a long one, but worth listening to…

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace 3-D
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 12, 2012 - It’s time for the iFanboy three to close the book on a legendary chapter in their lives. That’s right, we saw, and are now talking about, for what is destined to be the last time, Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace in 3D. Josh, Ron, and Conor have a long history with Star Wars, and this movie takes them back to another time. Does the revisitation reveal anything unexpected about the much maligned movie, or is it as bad as expected. Or is it worse. We try to be more positive than Captain Panaka, which isn’t very hard. We also have no army. Put on your 3D glasses, and sit back. We’re talking about Episode I.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #320 - Animal Man #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 05, 2012 – We don't seem to remember why, but this weeks comics are highlighted by the ALL TOM Feedback section towards the end of the podcast. Because we're crazy like that. Plain and simple. So crazy that in this edition we celebrate the use of a double negative. Plus, a comparison of a comic creator to a legendary punk band.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #319 - The Unwritten #33.5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 29, 2012 – We introduce you to Pepper, Cap’n and Ron this week on the Pick of the Week Podcast. We also find out how little the guys know about 1800s Europe and wonder how they even graduated high school in the first place.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #318 - Batman #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 22, 2012 – Josh has somewhere to be. He was ready, and just wants to get to the damn show! So let’s get on with it. It’s a twisty-turny Pick of the Week, and you shouldn’t drink the water. Eventually the talk turns to how to pass the time in solitary, and everyone gets along again. Plus we talk about gifts we got!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #317 - The Shade #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 15, 2012 – Despite a dominating week by a little known up and comer comics writer, the veterans of the comic book industry were victorious this week earning the pick of the week nod. Beyond that, it was a strong week that lead to some startling confessions and some Real World reminiscing amongst the iFanboy gang.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #316 - Peanuts #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 8, 2012 – The holidays are over and the guys are back! Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards are back to discuss the week in comics, the feminist propaganda in Peanuts, the difficulty of superheroes getting branded gear… and is that a whiff of Cthulhu?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com 2011 All Media Year End Round Up - Part Two!
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 2, 2012 – It’s the SIXTH annual iFanboy All Media Year End Round Up! Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick discuss everything they enjoyed in media in 2011. In part two it’s all about video games, books, podcasts, music, and comic books! Don’t forget to check out part one where we discussed movies and television of 2011! Music: Second Day of the Year Goldenboy

episodes.title: iFanboy.com 2011 All Media Year End Round Up - Part One!
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 26, 2011 – It’s the SIXTH annual iFanboy All Media Year End Round Up! Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick discuss everything they enjoyed in media in 2011. In part one it’s all about movies and television! Stay tuned next week for part two of the iFanboy All Media Year End Round Up where we discuss video games, books, podcasts, music, and comic books! Music: White Christmas The Wedding Present

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast -The Adventures of Tintin
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 26, 2011 - Paul Montgomery and Ron Richards gather over the holidays to chat about the holiday movie release of The Adventures of Tintin and The Secret of the Unicorn. With Peter Jackson and Steven Spielberg behind it, we wonder if the classic Franco-Belgian comic can come to life, even with the questionable animation style. Luckily, we were treated to a wonderful, high flying adventure movie that’s great for parents and kids alike!

episodes.title: Talksplode #50 – Rick Remender, writer of Uncanny X-Force, Secret Avengers, Venom and More
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 22, 2011 - Rick Remender is no stranger to the iFanboy Talksplode, but this time around he gives a brutally honest and frank look at his most recent work on Uncanny X-Force and Venom, as well as a look ahead as to what to expect from his upcoming Secret Avengers.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #315 - Severed #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 18, 2011 – Things get a little….heated this week on the Pick of the Week podcast as Josh, Conor and Ron wonder why they’re here and are reminded quickly that it’s comics…The one constant through all the years, Ray, has been comics. America has rolled by like an army of steamrollers. It has been erased like a blackboard, rebuilt and erased again. But comics has marked the time. These books, these characters: it’s a part of our past, Ray. It reminds of us of all that once was good and it could be again.

episodes.title: Talksplode #49 – Ron Marz, writer of Witchblade, Artifacts, Shinku and More
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 15, 2011 - Ron Marz has written a lot of comics. Starting out at Marvel, his first work was on a Silver Surfer Annual. Eventually he moved on to DC to create Kyle Rayner, an all new Green Lantern. While on that run, he had to deal with controversy, including fans angry about replacing Hal Jordan (or H.E.A.T. as some were known), as well as the more serious charges of violence against women being depicted in comics by the famous “Women in Refrigerators” protest, as started by Gail Simone.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #314 - Betrayal of the Planet of the Apes #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 11, 2011 – With Ron Richards away, iFanboy.com editor Paul Montgomery steps in just in time for Josh Flanagan to reveal a dark secret, Conor Kilpatrick’s plan to put comics out on a reliable monthly schedule. Plus: reel-to-reel editing and… STDs? Oh, yeah– and comics!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #313 - Near Death #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 4, 2011 – With no major releases from DC Comics, it might have been a light week for comics but Marvel Comics more than made up for it with some great books. And this week on the show, Josh Flanagan gets ganged up on by Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick… or does he?

episodes.title: Talksplode #48 – Filip Sablik, Top Cow and Pilot Season
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 1, 2011 - On this episode, Top Cow Publisher Filip Sablik takes some time to talk about this year’s Pilot Season contest. With eight new #1 issues each vying for the chance to continue their stories, we go through this year’s offerings, and talk about what goes into making these kinds of comics. We also catch up on the world of Top Cow, what role founder Marc Silvestri takes, and about the cool stuff coming out from the Minotaur imprint. We also touch on Filip’s work as a comic book writer, and fitting that into his other editorial work. Voting on Pilot Season begins on December 5 on TopCow.com. You can purchase, download, and read all the of this year’s Pilot Season offerings on Graphicly.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #312 - Comic Book Comics #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 27, 2011 –It’s a post Thanksgiving comics extravaganza as Josh and Ron joined by Jim Mroczkowski in the celebration of the past week’s worth of comics. It’s a podcast of amazingness as there’s very little controversy, just a good time comic bookin’ for all.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #311 - Batman #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 20, 2011 – Startling confessions of reading practices! Dangling participles in relation to Frank Miller! Inflammatory comments about ethnic groups! Bastardization of the English language! Inappropriate comparisons of comics to infectious diseases! It’s just another week in the iFanboy podcast as Josh, Conor and Ron can’t stay out of their own way. With a little bit of Keanu for good measure.

episodes.title: Talksplode #47 – Making and Drawing Comics with Kevin Mellon and Declan Shalvey
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 17, 2011 - After our last Talksplode episode about making comics with Blair Butler and Charles Soule from the writer’s perspective, we’re coming at it from the drawing table. Joining Josh Flanagan are Declan Shalvey (Thunderbolts, Northlanders) and Kevin Mellon (Heart, Gearhead). The conversation is long and ranges through many aspects of being an artist in today’s comic book industry. We’ll talk about the origins and breaking in stories, as well as the highs and lows of the industry. We talk about some of the challenges a comic book artist faces, and how writer and artist collaborate. There’s a lot of information to be gained, learning from people who’ve been there, and are still working at climbing their ladder, whatever that ladder may be. If you have any interest in making comics, either as an artist, writer, or whatever, this is an invaluable conversation.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #310 - Uncanny X-Force #17
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 13, 2011 – Do you think John Byrne is pure and clean? Do you write emails that don’t quite sound like normal English? If you like this and can tolerate comic books to a certain extent, this could be the show for you! Warcraft dreams!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #309 - Fear Agent #32
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 6, 2011 – Do you like sci-fi? How about Image Comics? If so, this is the episode for you! Also, there may be a gas leak in Conor’s apartment, Ron gives his mouth a nickname and Josh makes a stunning confession!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #308 - Wolverine and the X-Men #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 30, 2011 – A great week of comics and a mighty stack to get through, which means…THE BELL IS BACK! Join us as we work through the notable books this week in 15 seconds or less. There is no harsher mistress than the bell! Beware! And listen, we know they’re not pamphlets…

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #307- Uncanny X-Men #544
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 23, 2011 – Still recovering from the New York Comic Con, we get back to a semblance of normalness as the streak of consecutive picks of the week by DC Comics is broken by Ron and his love for all things X-Men and Marvel. It was bound to happen sooner or later. Deal with it.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Batman: Year One
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 20, 2011 - They might be down a man, but the iFanboy Animation Braintrust has reconvened to discuss the latest DC Universe Animated Original Movie, Batman: Year One. Was the Bruce Timm-lead adaptation of the Frank Miller/David Mazzucchelli classic the best adpatation yet? Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Ryan Haupt have some thoughts. Also! The Showcase Shorts return with the Paul Dini written Catwoman. Plus! What to make of the next film, Justice League: Doom, and the possibilities of seeing an animated version of Batman: The Dark Knight Returns!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #306 - American Vampire: Survival of the Fittest #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 17, 2011 – NEW YORK COMIC COOOOOON! After plans fell through to do the show as usual, the guys are forced to record a truncated episode from their table in Artist’s Alley on Sunday afternoon, the last day of the show. Listen to the raw pain in their voices! LISTEN!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #305 - O.M.A.C. #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 9, 2011 – A return to normalcy as we’re finally done wi– wait, what? There are more new DC books? Crap. Also, we figure out just how many plots there are and examine life on Utopia.

episodes.title: Talksplode #46 - Making Comics with Blair Butler and Charles Soule
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 6, 2011 - This is a very cool episode of Talksplode. We’ve got Blair Butler of G4′s Attack of the Show and writer of the upcoming Image series, Heart, and Charles Soule, writer of 27, also from Image Comics, but we’re not just going to be plugging books. Along with Josh Flanagan, also a comic book writer looking to get published, the discussion is all about making comics, breaking in, getting started, finding artists, and the real things involved in the process. From marketing to design to scripting to page layout, we cover a lot of ground in this lengthy and diverse discussion about what’s it’s like to make professional, independent comics today. Part of the discussion was based on this piece, Making Comics: Why I’ve Failed So Far. Make sure to follow Blair and Charles on Twitter for updates on their comic book adventures. You can also go to Blair’s website and Charles’ blog. To read some of Josh’s comic work, you can find that here. Look for Heart from Blair Butler and Kevin Mellon in November, and read 27: The Second Set, in shops now, both from Image. You can also read the first issue of Dixon’s Notch, written by Josh Flanagan on Graphicly. Music: For Beginners M. Ward

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #304 - The Flash #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 2, 2011 – It’s the final week of new DC #1 issues and we’re still rating them all! This is it! No more!

episodes.title: Talksplode #45 with J.H. Williams III, W. Haden Blackman, and Mitch Gerads
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 29, 2011 - We’ve got a double Talksplode for you today with 2 bite sized conversations, perfect for your comics podcasting pleasure. First up, Paul Montgomery was granted some time with the creators of Batwoman #1, J.H. Williams III, and W. Haden Blackman. They talk about finally getting this series to the shelves, and what’s in store for Kathy Kane in her new life. The collaborators also touch on their creative process, as Williams is not only artist, but co-writer. Finally, we clear up some questions about Renee Montoya and her status, as well as Agent Chace. Next, Josh Flanagan speaks to Mitch Gerads, an up and coming artist, known for his bombastic colors on Stan Lee’s Starborn. A relative newcomer, Mitch will certainly garner some name recognition when his creator owned series The Activity, written by Nathan Edmondson, debuts in December from Image Comics. Additionally we talk his work on Doctor Whofor IDW, and about what the online community, Twitter, and Mitch’s relationship with ComicTwart have done for him professionally. If you don’t know the name, you will, so learn how to pronounce it. Take a look at some of Mitch’s art below. Music: Don’t Make Me a Target Spoon

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #303 - Wonder Woman #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 25, 2011 - Another 13 12 books from DC, and another wad of comics from everyone else, and we’re still going to fit in as much as we can. This is the third week of new DC #1 issues, and we’re rating every one of them. One week to go! This show is either sexy or sexist, and we can’t tell, because it might be a script error. Let’s just get to it and get rating!

episodes.title: Talksplode #44 with Scott Snyder of Batman, Swamp Thing, American Vampire, and Severed
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 22, 2011 - Scott Snyder is a writer on the rise, but at this point, it’s hard to see how much higher his star can rise. With the release of Batman #1 and Swamp Thing #1 in the new DC Comics lineup, Snyder has seen critical and commercial success, and even managed to make the hardcore fans happy. Teaming with spectacular artists over and over again, like Greg Capullo on Batman, Yannick Paquette on Swamp Thing, Scott’s got a lot to be proud of. We talk in depth about what’s going on with Bruce Wayne and Alec Holland, as well as what’s to come with American Vampire and where Severed came from. As always, Scott is candid and in depth on every question, from his early interactions with Greg Capullo to considerations of fan reactions to the DC changes. Plus, how old is Jim Gordon anyway? Music: Jailhouse Rock Elvis Presley

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #302 - Demon Knights #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 18, 2011 – The DC Comics Relaunch deluge continues, along with some fantastic comics from practically every publisher. If you’re a comic fan, than this was one of those dream weeks. Unfortunately, 13 more DC Comics are starting to push Josh, Conor and Ron towards the breaking point – but hey! They’re having fun while doing it! And now…Ratings…Ratings…Ratings…

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #301 - Animal Man #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 11, 2011 – It’s a deluge of comic books! We embark on “The New 52″ from DC Comics as we rate and review all 13 of the new DC Comics releases, as well as a ton of books from the other publishers in the world. It’s all comic books, all the time, so it’s a bit longer than usual, but it’s something we must do, for you.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #300 - Justice League #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 04, 2011 – It’s the 300th episode extravaganza! Recorded live on UStream on September 2, 2011 in front of an audience of the iFanboy faithful, Josh, Conor and Ron do their weekly comic book talkin’ thing along with answering some questions from the live audience. A absolute blast was had by all and we thank everyone who watched the show live and to everyone who has listened for 300 episodes!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #299 - Wolverine #14
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 28, 2011 - Well folks, this one went a bit off the rails, especially at the end. But that just means that it’s more fun podcast listenin’ for you. The episode before our 300th, Josh, Conor and Ron find new things to enjoy about their comics, mainly…the clowns and debating photo realism. In addition to the clowns, we’ve got information about our 300th episode extravaganza

episodes.title: Talksplode #43 with Rick Remender of Strange Girl, Uncanny X-Force and Venom
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 25, 2011 - One of our long time favorite series over the past 10 years has been Strange Girl from Image Comics, written by Rick Remender with art by Eric Nguyen, Jerome Opena and many more. This September, Strange Girl is scheduled to get the Omnibus treatment, which is a great opportunity for those of you who missed the series the first time around in issues, or the second time around in trades. We thought it would be a good time to catch up with writer Rick Remender and look back and reflect on Strange Girl, as well catch up on his latest work at Marvel Comics with Venom and Uncanny X-Force. Be sure to check out our Week of Strange Girl posts: Rick Remender's Foreward The Art of Eric Nguyen The Art of Jerome Opena Music: Girl Afraid The Smiths

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #298 - Flashpoint: The Outsider #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 21, 2011 – This week: Ron Richards reads a lot from Wikipedia, Josh Flanagan pitches a new book for Marvel, and Conor Kilpatrick reveals a bit too much about his reality television viewing habits!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Conan The Barbarian
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 19, 2011 - Paul Montgomery and Matt Adler join forces against the nightmarish legions of Hyboria! It’s been nearly 30 years since Arnold first took up the broadsword of Conan the Barbarian. Is Jason Momoa up to the task of crushing his enemies? Is the latest film incarnation of Robert E. Howard’s iconic hero reason for gigantic mirth or gigantic melancholy? Is this what’s best in life?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #297 - Detective Comics #881
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 14, 2011 - Josh Flanagan has a very emotional week when two of his favorite characters "die". How does he cope? By talking a lot about the books he read this past week. Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick are also on the show. Plus: More hobo talk!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #296 - Severed #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 7, 2011 - A bizarre obsession with hobos and movie stills takes over the podcast this week as Josh, Conor and Ron spent most of their time in the early 1900s for this week thanks to some great comic books and graphic novels. Oh, and no sports!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Cowboys and Aliens
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 4, 2011 - Delayed a few days by San Diego Comic-Con, a passel of iFanboys--namely Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, and Paul Montgomery--were rustled up to talk about Cowboys and Aliens, the latest film from Iron Man director Jon Favreau. How does this genre mash-up fare in this summer of comic book movies? Can James Bond and Indiana Solo save the day? And how does The Adventures of Pete and Pete fit into all of this?

episodes.title: Talksplode #42 with Brian Churilla of The Secret History of D.B. Cooper
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 4, 2011 - If you've been keeping track of the news recently, you my have heard that the FBI has announced some leads in the 40 year old case of D.B. Cooper, the man who mysteriously hijacked a plane and parachuted away with $200,000 over the Pacific Northwest. It's one of those classic American unsolved mysteries, but Oni Press has something to say about that. Today Oni Press announces the new ongoing series, beginning in March 2012: The Secret History of D.B. Cooper, by Brian Churilla. Oni revealed that this book has been in production for some time and that the recent news from the FBI is an attempt to discredit the upcoming comic series, which promises to tell the tale of D.B. Cooper, who has become a mythic folk hero, revealing that the "D.B. Cooper Incident" was not a hijacking and extortion plot. Rather, D.B. Cooper was a covert operative whose actions nearly changed the course of human history We had a chance to chat with Brian Churilla about The Secret History of D.B. Cooper where he gives iFanboy the exclusive scoop

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #295 - Venom #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 31, 2011 - Recovering from the San Diego Comic-Con, Josh, Conor and Ron have strained voices but that doesn't stop them from wondering how Bruce Wayne gets away with all those wards and then they get distracted by Serpentor. Again.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Captain America: The First Avenger
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 28, 2011 - With the San Diego Comic-Con behind them, Josh, Conor and Ron gather to reminsce about seeing Captain America: The First Avenger in San Diego and break down what tthey liked and didn't like about the most patriotic movie released in years.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #294 - Daredevil #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 24, 2011 - LIVE....from our hotel room in San Diego while attending the San Diego Comic-Con, Josh, Conor and Ron take a break from the convention to talk the amazing Daredevil #1, as well as a bunch of other comics in this abbreviated episode. Just straight comic talk and unfortunately due to the crazyness of the con, no detailed show notes until later this week.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #293 - Batgirl #23
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 17, 2011 - Conor struggles with one of those weeks which leads to a new segment where we try to understand why he didn't pick other books. Meanwhile, Josh and Ron struggle with too many good books to choose from and yet breakout into The Electric Slide? And then we hear some feedback from a listener and...well, shit get's real.

episodes.title: Talksplode #41 with Sam Humphries of Our Love is Real
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 14, 2011 - A surprise hit of this summer has been the self published one shot Our Love Is Real written by Sam Humphries with art by Steven Sanders. With a limited print run and same day digital availability, Our Love Is Real has the comics industry buzzing in reaction to this sci-fi meets romance story in a world where people love their dogs, vegetables and even minerals. We spoke with writer Sam Humphries to get the story behind Our Love Is Real as well as their unique approach to publishing. If you're an aspiring comics creator, you're definitely going to want to listen to this.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #292 - Moon Knight #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 10, 2011 - The gang's back together as Conor returns from his mysterious adventures to rejoin Josh and Ron, whose favorite books this week will surprise you.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Transformers 3: Dark of the Moon
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 10, 2011 - Well, it may be a week later, but Conor, Ron and Ryan saw Transformers 3: Dark of the Moon and despite the best of hopes, they gathered for what was a very quick and concise podcast discussion, a lesson that Michael Bay could learn from...

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #291 - Scalped #50
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 3, 2011 - Conor got taken by the law once more, so iFanboy stalwart Paul Montgomery joins Ron and Josh, and we almost do a show about robots. In the absence of that, a challenge is issued at the last moment. Will you heed the call? Also, comics.

episodes.title: Talksplode #40 with Robert Kirkman of The Infinite, Super Dinosaur, The Walking Dead and Invincible
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 1, 2011 - If you know iFanboy, you know we never turn down the opportunity to talk to Robert Kirkman, so when the chance to chat with Robert on the phone about this new project, The Infinite with Rob Liefeld came up, Josh and Ron took one for the team and went a few rounds with Kirkman. Always hilarious and honest, Kirkman tells us what The Infinite is, his theories on time travel stories, why he previously hasn't liked to write endings, as well as glimpse into his life of not really liking people dressed up as zombies on the set of The Walking Dead along with what his son really thinks of Super Dinosaur

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #290 - The Rocketeer Adventures #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 26, 2011 - A stunning change of events this week as after 290 episodes, the guys decide to change the format of the show. Now EVERYONE AGREES WITH EVERYONE ELSE! It's much better this way, don't you think? Plus bonus comedy action of Conan and Thor discussing chicks and awkward social situations with Judd Winick

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #289 - Invincible #80
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 19, 2011 - Conor returns, it's hot out, Ron is patronizing towards Canada, and Game of Thrones finds its way into the discussion (a lot ). This one goes off the rails almost immediately.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Green Lantern
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 19.2011 - We're back for another comic book movie special edition podcast, and unlike the last one, this discussion of the eagerly awaited Green Lantern movie isn't as gushy. While Josh, Conor and Ron are in agreement that the movie isn't as bad as some are making it out to be, the movie certainly has it's problems....

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #288 - American Vampire: Survival of the Fittest #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 12, 2011 - Conor has run for the border, and left us with staff writer Ryan Haupt to do the show with Josh and Ron. There is a stack of very fun books, and at least one of us read at least some of them. Then, appropriate to Ryan on the show, we make with the science. And a special guest from the past!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Green Lantern: Emerald Knights
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: 06.09.2011 - With Conor on a diplomatic mission deep in Sector 8974, Paul Montgomery, Christopher Neseman and Ryan Haupt take to the air to discuss the latest direct to video offering from Warner Bros. and DC Animation. Green Lantern: Emerald Knights sees Nathon Fillion in the role of Hal Jordan as the seasoned Lantern recounts a handful of classic tales from the lore of the Corps. How does it stack up against Green Lantern: First Flight or the previous anthology feature Batman: Gotham Knight? You'll have to tune in for all the constructive criticism.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #287 - Criminal: The Last of the Innocent #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 5, 2011 - Suburban Tragedy as the guys have a ton of comics to discuss this week, an embarassment of riches in fact. Throw in an e-mail asking for opinions on the DC Comics reboot and you've got the makings for a podcast, good thing we were recording...

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - X-Men: First Class
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 5, 2011 - The dark horse of the comic book movies of 2011, X-Men: First Class directed by Matthew Vaughn held the hopes and dreams of X-Men fans in it's hands. Would we be wooed by the retro-1960s tale of the X-Men's first days? Would this be able to make us forget about the recent abominations of X-Men movies since X2? Ron, Josh and Conor gather to answer with a unified and resounding, YES! So much so that Ron possibly may explode from excitement as Josh and Conor watch. Music: Palisades Park Freddy Cannon

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #286 - Wolverine #9
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 29, 2011 - The original three are reunited to talk of the books of the week! The takeaways are that Ron is very happy with X-Men, and everyone is very happy with Jason Aaron. And we didn't even talk about his beard! Also, as always happens, it's starting to get hot!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #285 - Avengers #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 22, 2011 - When a questionable bit of scheduling finds both Josh Flanagan and Ron Richards out and about on vacation, a very tired Conor Kilpatrick is joined by an equally tired Paul Montgomery and an under-the-weather Jim Mroczkowski to talk about the week in comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Smallville
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 19, 2011 - iFanboy's Smallvile Brain Trust - Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, Mike Romo, and Paul Montgomery - gather to remember 10 years of Smallville and break down the final episode. It's a free wheeling conversation that touches on everything from memories of the show's beginning, the high points, the low points, and everything in-between. Music: Save Me Remy Zero

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #284 - Chew #27
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 15, 2011 - A strategic error this week gives you the listener a bonus, expanded episode! Starting off reminiscing about our favorite phone information service is followed by confusion as to why Joe Quesada was in Flashpoint and what Superman would do in Portland, followed up with alot of discussion about this week's comics.
