Why don't you just tell me the comic book you'd like to read?

episodes.title: Talksplode #39 with Cullen Bunn, writer of Sixth Gun, Fear Itself: The Deep, and The Tooth
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 12,2011 - Fans of writer Cullen Bunn have a lot to look forward to this summer. On the heels of its first anniversary, his occult western The Sixth Gun enters its third ongoing arc, and the second paperback volume is due out in just a few weeks. Later this month we'll see his other Oni project The Tooth, a monster-stomping, anthropomorphic fang OGN drawn by Matt Kindt. Fans of DC's magic characters like Klarion the Witch Boy and the cast of Shadowpact will want to pick up Sorcerer Kings, his four-issue arc on Superman/Batman. Then in June and July, Bunn is hip-deep in Marvel's Fear Itself, with one-shots for Black Widow and the FF, and a four-part Defenders series called Fear Itself: The Deep. Paul talks to Bunn about all of these titles as well as the task of juggling creator-owned and licensed projects, capturing the distinct voices of Natasha Romanoff and the Silver Surfer, Bunn's recent transition to writing full time, and one creepy-ass goat.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #283 - Moon Knight #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 8, 2011 - Gathered at Ron's sister's house, Ron Richards, Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan decided to spontaneously jump on USTREAM to live stream the recording of this week's show! Featuring special appearances by Mark Wahlberg, NY1's Lewis Dodley, and Ron's niece Amelia.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Thor
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 6, 2011 - 'Pon this day, Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, and Josh Flanagan did gather to discuss the latest of Marvel Studios' big summer movies - Thor! What was good? (A lot.) What was bad? (Not much.) What was ugly? (Certainly not a shirtless Chris Hemsworth.) And how does it hold up to the previous Marvel Studios films that are paving the way for The Avengers? Find out now! Verily! Music: The Frost Giant's Daughter The Sword

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #282 - New York Five #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 1, 2011 - If we might be so bold, it's a good 'un this week, with lots and lots of comics, and brainteasing Superman conundrums. If you're holdin' or not, come along and see. Also, Muppets Take Manhattan is explored.

episodes.title: Talksplode #38 with Mark Andrew Smith, writer of Gladstone's School for World Conquerers
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 28,2011 - Mark Andrew Smith lives and teaches English in Taiwain, but over the past few years he's amassed a number of credits and accolades in the comics industry. He co-created the Eisner Award winning Popgun anthology series and developed a number of creator-owned works through Image Comics. 2011 sees the debut of a new all-ages ongoing called Gladstone's School for World Conquerors as well as a second volume of his celebrated New Brighton Archaeological Society. Mark talks to us about the perils and pitfalls of producing all-ages work and discusses both failures and successes in crowdsourcing through Kickstarter. How do you make such fundraising websites work for you, and what does it all mean for the industry?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #281 - Sixth Gun #11
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 24, 2011 - There's disagreement from the start on this one! But we get it together, and cover a whole lot of comic ground. Like baseball or not, that's not the point. Also, ignore the construction and coughing.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #280 - Punisher Max #12
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 17, 2011 - This week Ron Richards really doesn't like photos in comics, reveals his philosophy on the history and importance of the Uncanny X-Men, and has trouble remembering a classic childhood cartoon. Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan are also on the show.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #279 - Uncanny X-Men #534.1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 10, 2011 - Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick return from a long month of comic book conventions to leap into the welcoming and loving arms of Josh Flanagan. Or something like that. Either way, they talk comic books.

episodes.title: Talksplode #37 with Matt Fraction of Fear Itself, Uncanny X-Men + Casanova
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 7, 2011 - With the release of the mega event, Fear Itself, from Marvel Comics, we thought it would be a good time to chat with writer Matt Fraction. Fraction tells us what the approach to Fear Itself has been, how he's handling the event status and yet making it a managable, contained story, and what the fan reaction to the book is so far. We also get a tease of what's to come in his upcoming The Mighty Thor. In addition to Fear Itself and Thor, we talk a bit about the close of Fraction's run on Uncanny X-Men and he feels he did on the title and what's to come for Marvel's mutants. On the creator side of things, we get an update on the progress of Casanova and what Fraction's thoughts are around creator owned work vs. work for publishers like Marvel.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #278 - Walking Dead #83
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 3, 2011 - The road calls again, with Ron and Conor away at WonderCon in San Francisco, Josh breaks every conceivable rule and talks about what actually happens in the comic book you don't talk about. Staff writers Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt join in and say a lot nice things about a lot of very good books.

episodes.title: Talksplode #36 with Ruwan Jayatilleke - Thor + Loki: Blood Brothers
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 31, 2011 - Building off the momentum of last year's motion comic, Iron Man: Extremis, Marvel is back but now with a story about Thor. Recently dubbed Marve Knights Animation, Ruwan Jayatilleke of Marvel, returns to tell us all about the exciting new animation project that pits brother against brother as Loki makes his power move against Asgard, Odin and Thor. We discuss the production of the new animation project, the success of the previous one, the evolution from motion comic to animation and much much more.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #277 - FF #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 27, 2011 - After surviving C2E2 in Chicago, Conor, Ron and Josh reunite for the pick of the week podcast and confirm that indeed all 3 guys are on the take from Jonathan Hickman. Also the magical powers of Kirk and Venkman and pondered in ways that should never have been.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #276 - Power Girl #22
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 20, 2011 - With management off in Chi-Town for C2E2, iFanboy.com staff writers Ryan Haupt, Jim Mroczkowski, Mike Romo, and Paul Montgomery commune for another takeover of the Pick of the Week podcast! It's a moose of a show, but it's filled with divergent opinions, Science, and behind the scenes drama. Plus, Jim has conniption over some frustrating photo referencing.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #275 - Ultimate Spider-Man #155
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 13, 2011 - Conor and Ron make their triumphant return after Emerald City Comic Con in Seattle, much to Josh's chagrin. To make matters worse, they're all together in Brooklyn and Josh and Conor get awkwardly intimate as they share a mic. Good thing it was a great week for comics, which made the sexual tension much easier to deal with.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #274 - Axe Cop Bad Guy Earth #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 6, 2011 - Ron and Conor are off in Seattleville, or Pacficinorthwestburg, or some such, so Josh handles the shop, and invites iFanboy writers Paul Montgomery and Tom Katers on the show to fill in, and much merriment is had by all and more agreement than usual. Plus, apparently if you need a shanty-ish room, Red Lobster may or may not be the place for you.

episodes.title: Talksplode #35 with Skottie Young of Ozma of Oz and The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 3, 2011 - We've known and been big fans of Skottie Young for a long time, but he's never actually been on a Talksplode episode until now. Josh Flanagan talks with the Eisner winning artist about his career and origin, as well as how it lead to the offbeat series of books like The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, The Marvelous Land of Oz, and Ozma of Oz, with writer Eric Shanower. We talk about some of the work Skottie has done for Marvel Comics over the last ten years, and how C.B. Cebulski picked him from a random table at a Chicago comic convention. Then we talk about Skottie's creator owned work, and his push to sell digital material on his own, as well as his upcoming writing stint in Deadpool Team Up.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #273 - Fantastic Four #588
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 27, 2011 - It's time to celebrate the triumphant return of iFanboy staff writer Mike Romo to the podcast as he fillls in for Josh and joins Ron and Conor to continue the gushing over Jonathan Hickman and the celebration of some pretty sad and morbid comics amongst this packed week of comics, which actually was a great week for art!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - All-Star Superman
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 24, 2011 - iFanboy assembles its crack animation trask force as Conor Kilpatrick, Chris Neseman, and staff writers Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt break down the latest DC Universe Animated Original film - All-Star Superman! Also discussed is the sad, untimely passing of writer Dwayne McDuffie, All-Star Superman the comic series, the nature of Superman as a character, the deficiencies of Ryan's girlfriend, and the future of the DC Universe Animated Original Movies. Featuring a guest appearance by Chris Neseman's dogs.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #272 - S.H.I.E.L.D. #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 20, 2011 - While Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards have a ho-hum week of comics, Josh Flanagan steps it up and decides to finally embrace fun. And there's just a little bit of G.I. Joe and a little bit of L.A. Confidential in this one too.

episodes.title: Talksplode #34 with Rick Remender, writer of Bulletstorm, Uncanny X-Force and Venom
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 17, 2011 - After a little bit of controversy around the video game Bulletstorm that he wrote, we figured it would be a good time to check in with writer Rick Remender and hear his thoughts about the attention Fox News gave his video game, as well talk about the upcoming Venom series he'll be writing with art by Tony Moore, as well as check in on his latest hit with Uncanny X-Force and the future plans for that book. We also sneak some Fear Agent talk into the mix as well, cause well, we love it so.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #271 - Knight and Squire #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 13, 2011 - Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards are helpless before the power of Star Wars as it almost completely takes over half the show.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #270 - Brightest Day #19
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 6, 2011 - With Josh Flanagan dialing in from parts unknown (okay, it's Boston), Conor Kilpatrick decides to start doing voices, and Ron Richards makes an on-the-spot decision about his own Pick of the Week.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #269 - Fantastic Four #587
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 30, 2011 - It's the 10th Anniversary party at Bergen Street Comics in Brooklyn, and a whole hell of a lot of people turned up. Join us as we search for the credit box, and even welcome a few special guests. It's a big show, and there are a whole lot of comics to get through.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #268 - Hellblazer #275
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 23, 2011 - This week, the question is asked, "If a pick of the week falls in the forest, does anyone care?" but Josh does and that's ok by us. Throw in some anger and frustration about the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway and a voicemail caller who's having a better time than we are, and all's right in the world.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #267 - Batgirl #17
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 16, 2011 - Josh may be on his own with his one man comedy show, but Ron and Conor hang in there as the guys talk comics, bolo ties and western fashion, outing unwitting listener's awkward social situations and Moby Dick

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - The Green Hornet
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 16, 2011 - Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards sit down to discuss The Green Hornet, the super hero action comedy from director Michel Gondry and writer and star Seth Rogan. Was the film successful in what it wanted to be? Why does IMDB have the wrong actor listed as playing Kato? Would you rather pay a premium for a 3D film or a theater without kids? And what are the upcoming comics book/super hero movies in 2011? They examine all these questions and more!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #266 - Starman/Congorilla #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 9, 2011 - It's the first Pick of the Week Podcast in 2011 and the guys try to shake off the rust after a few weeks of not doing the show. This week, Ron goes with a wild car Pick, Josh channels Ron, and Conor wants one of his favorite books to go quarterly.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - The Best of the Pick of the Week Podcast 2005-2010
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 2, 2011 - Trapped on an elevator en route to the big iFanboy tenth anniversary party, staff writers Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt count down the top ten moments of the Pick of the Week Podcast. Will enough oxygen remain for these two to recount your favorite inside joke or uncomfortable tangent? Will Middle Management Red Skull or Bad Roommate Black Panther walk away with the prized number one slot? Only one way to find out!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com 2010 All Media Year End Round Up!
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 26, 2010 - It's the FIFTH annual All Media Year End Round Up! Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick discuss everything they enjoyed in 2010 in movies, television, music, video games and of course, comic books. For reasons unknown it's a bit speedier than normal, but whattya gonna do? Enjoy! (Sorry about the heavy breathing. We got a bit mic careless.)

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #265 - Strange Tales II #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 19, 2010 - It's the final Pick of the Week Podcast of 2010! Ron is drunk, the bell returns, the guys answer a whole bunch of neglected voicemails, and Josh may or may not admit to being close to snapping! Happy Holidays, everybody!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #264 - Justice League: Generation Lost #15
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 12, 2010 - If you thought last week's episode was wacky, wait until you get about 3/4s of the way through this episode. Whew. We may have another character meme to add to the library as Josh, Conor and Ron make some very inappropriate jokes about Thor's personal life. Oh, and we discuss the comics that came out this week, you know how that goes..

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #263 - Baltimore: The Plague Ships #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 5, 2010 - We'll be honest, this is a wacky one. Ron's amped up, Josh talks endlessly and Conor's got a cloud over his head in this week of not too many books purchased by our heroic three. Can 8 books each provide enough fodder for an entire show? YOU DECIDE!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #262 - Ultimate Spider-Man #150
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 28, 2010 - This holiday season, Ron Richards, Josh Flanagan, and Conor Kilpatrick gather together to give thanks to comic books, solve the Iceman problem, and go down a Harry Potter slash fiction rabbit hole.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #261 - Batman Incorporated #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 21, 2010 - Not only are the guys back together, they're in person in the warmth of Brooklyn and apparently on speed. But that doesn't keep them from discussing the top books of the week, argue over the harsh realities of the comic book industry and direct market, and avoid the haunting by the Brooklyn ghost.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #260 - American Vampire #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 14, 2010 - With Ron Richards mysteriously disappearing, iFanboy staff writer Paul Montgomery steps up to join Conor Kilpatrick and Josh Flanagan to talk about the week that was in comics. Plus! A discussion of the new issue of G.I. Joe devolves into a quick rundown of the shows on The Hub. Also! Paul reveals his heretofore hidden talents as a hypeman. And a bizarre accent.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #259 - Amazing Spider-Man #647
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 07, 2010 - It's the fifth anniversary of the iFanboy Pick of the Week Podcast! On this extra long anniversary episode (recorded live over USTREAM) Josh Flanagan, Conor Kilpatrick, and Ron Richards talk about the week in comics, tell some stories from the past five years, and at least one of the guys throws his headset down in disgust! No Lego X-Wings were harmed in the recording of this episode. AUDIO NOTE: We recorded this episode live on USTREAM and so we used a slightly different audio set up than normal. As a result, there were some problems with Josh's audio. We fixed the most glaring issues with Josh's mic after the first five minutes or so, but up until that point the audio quality is not what you would normally expect from our show. There are also a few random audio glitches here and there throughout the show (as a result of the afroementioned problems with Josh's mic) that we couldn't do anyting about. We apologize.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #258 - Fantastic Four #584
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 31, 2010 - Conor Kilpatrick returns to the show but not even he and Josh Flanagan can convince Ron Richards to get past his irrational dislike of Superman to read a book that doesn't even feature Superman. Confused? So were they.

episodes.title: Booksplode #6 - Nextwave: Agents of H.A.T.E.
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 28, 2010 - Josh Flanagan, Jim Mroczkowski, and Ryan Haupt gather to officially discuss Warren Ellis and Stuart Immonen's short lived, but brilliant series, Nextwave: Agents of H.A.T.E. With a few years between the release of the material, the discussion plumbs the absolute depths of what the series has to offer, from wacky fun, an actual if not hidden reverence for Marvel Comics, and some of the best artwork to ever be captured on a comic book page. It was a complete package from cover to recap to letter page. It was not long for the world of publishing, with only 12 issues released, and the vaguest tease of future stories, we got what we got, and that was something special that you weren't going to see anywhere else.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #257 - Hulk #26
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 24, 2010 - It's an extra special, extended edition of the iFanboy Pick of the Week podcast, as Conor's absence gives Josh and Ron an excuse to have Evie Nagy of the Awesomed by Comics podcast onto the show, and boy did she bring the goods.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #256 - Irredeemable #18
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 17, 2010 - The iFanboy Three have survived the New York Comic Con and have warded off illness (as best they can) to bring you the latest and greatest in the world of comic books.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Red
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 17, 2010 - Ron Richards, Conor Kilpatrick and special guest John Suintres from Word Balloon gather together one last time... No, that's not right. I mean, they get together for one final mission... No, that's not right, either. They gathered together to talk about Red, the big screen adaptation of the three issue mini-series from Warren Ellis and Cully Hamner. With a cast of big names like Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, Mary Louise Parker, Karl Urban, and Richard Dreyfuss - how can it lose? Music Same Old Drag Apples in Stereo

episodes.title: Talksplode #32 with Scott Snyder of American Vampire and Detective Comics
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 14, 2010 - Scott Snyder joins Josh Flanagan for a nice long talk about Scott's entry into comics, as well as his work on the highly acclaimed American Vampire, and Stephen King's involvement. Then Scott talks for a long time about his work and thoughts on Batman, as his debut with Detective Comics #871, with art by Jock is on the horizon in November. This is a Talksplode for the writers out there. Look for the American Vampire vol. 1 hardcover, collecting the first arc, with art by Rafael Albuquerque. Check out Scott's website, or follow him on Twitter. (Note: This was recorded before news about the Commissioner Gordon backup was announced in Detective Comics.)

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #255 - Uncanny X-Force #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: Running Time: 00:59:05 October 10, 2010 - Recorded before New York Comic-Con wore Ron, Josh and Conor into the ground, this week's show mostly focused on all the Nazis showing up in most of the comics of the week. Also, we talk about the Pick of the Week, Uncanny X-Force #1, by Rick Remender and Jerome Opena. No show notes this week because of New York Comic-Con. Sponsors: This episode of iFanboy is brought to you by: In Stock Trades - Get all your trade paperpacks and hardcovers with amazing savings of up to 37%! Music: Good Guys (Don't Wear White) Minor Threat

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Superman/Batman: Apocalypse
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: 10.07.2010 - Conor Kilpatrick, Chris Neseman, and staff writers Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt break down the latest DC Universe Animated Original film - Superman/Batman: Apocalypse! Did the first DC Universe Animated Original sequel continue the high level of quality established by the last two films? Did it match up to the first Superman/Batman film? Plus, the latest Showcase short film: Green Arrow! Music: Woman Wolfmother

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #254 - Action Comics #893
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 3, 2010 - An unexpected cold strikes Josh down and makes him unable to record, so the erstwhile Tom Katers steps in to fill in and we'll be honest...things get weird. But we all know that when that happens, it's a good thing.

episodes.title: Talksplode #31 with Ryan Stegman of She-Hulks
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 30, 2010 - Ryan Stegman is a newly exclusive Marvel artist. You might might know him from his work on the Sif one-shot, or a run on Incredible Hercules, but soon he'll be performing art duties on his first ongoing series, She-Hulks, with writer Harrison Wilcox, debuting in November. Josh Flanagan took some time to talk to Ryan about working on the new series, breaking in to comics, drawing the sexy ladies, and what exactly means to be "exclusive". Do yourself a favor follow Ryan on Twitter, and make sure to check out She-Hulks when it's released.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #253 - Superman/Batman #76
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 26, 2010 - A late night recording session in the midst of the last gasps of summer leads to another wacky show as Conor tries to get a word in edgewise during the discussion of his own Pick of the Week, Ron is exhausted from a long week in comics media, and Josh manages to make it through an entire discussion about Hulk without mentioning that Hulk is strongest one there is.

episodes.title: Talksplode #30 with Jim McCann of Return of the Dapper Men
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 23, 2010 - Coming off a year or so of some great work at Marvel on Hawkeye + Mockingbird, Jim McCann and Janet Lee are now delivering an original graphic novel, Return of the Dapper Men, published by Archaia. Scheduled to launch at the New York Comic Con, and available worldwide in November, Return of the Dapper Men is a modern day fairy tale, truly for all ages and with some artwork like you've never seen before. Jim McCann, no stranger to the Talksplode, visits with us to tell us about the inspirations, the process and the journey involved in creating and publishing Return of the Dapper Men. To see Janet Lee's art work from our C2E2 episode of the iFanboy video show from back in April, to see exactly what Jim is talking about as he raves about her art style. Return of the Dapper Men is available for pre-order through Diamond, as well as on Amazon.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #252 - The Unwritten #17
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 19, 2010 - Pick your own Pick! Ron went with the myriad choices of a choose your own adventure, and then we get sidetracked for most of the rest of the episode by Ron's new obsession with Steve Rogers' incredibly judgemental attitude towards his "peers". We try to reign this one in, but it got away from us a little bit.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #251 - Thor: The Mighty Avenger #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 12, 2010 - Things kick off with an intervention after Conor's "performance" on the 250th episode, but the guys quickly work through their issues just in time to tackle even more issues, like a fear of the south, an appreciation for the movie Young Guns, and dealing with Dave Gibbons just not calling us to thank us. The nerve.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #250: Avengers: The Children's Crusade #2 - Part Two
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 09, 2010 - iFanboy celebrates its 250th episode with a quadruple-sized all-e-mail spectacular! We asked you the iFanbase to send us e-mails on any topic you wanted and boy did you deliver! We had so much fun answering so many e-mails and drinking way too much booze that we had to break the show up into two parts!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #250: Avengers: The Children's Crusade #2 - Part One
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 05, 2010 - iFanboy celebrates its 250th episode with a quadruple-sized all-e-mail spectacular! We asked you the iFanbase to send us e-mails on any topic you wanted and boy did you deliver! We had so much fun answering so many e-mails and drinking way too much booze that we had to break the show up into two parts!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #249 - Justice League Generation Lost #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 29, 2010 - Conor's gone missing...again, so the conch shell was blown and the intrepid Paul Montgomery joins the fray as Josh and Ron discuss the week's book as well as pressing social issues in the life of a comic fan. It's one for the ages folks as the levels of passive aggression reach new heights

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #248 - Chew #13
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 22, 2010 - Ron is off doing the galivanting. So we brought in our man, Jim Mroczkowski to fill in for the be-Marveled one. We handle the comics of the week, and try to figure out how you can be as fast as three men. It's always something, man.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #247 - Morning Glories #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 15, 2010 - With Josh in the wilderness of New England, Ron and Conor tap the mighty Tom Katers to enter the fray once again and wax poetic on the magic of comic books. Won't you join us?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Scot Pilgrim Vs. The World
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 13, 2010 - Look out all you evil exes! Scott Pilgrim vs. The World finally blasts its way into theaters! Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick talk about pre-release jitters, problems with marketing, Edgar Wright's track record, box office predictions, the future of unknown property comic book movies, and oh yeah, Scott Pilgrim vs. The World. Are you going to see it? Of course you are! So let's talk about it! As always, from here on out, in the podcast and comments, you have been spoiler-warned. Music: We Are Sex Bob-Omb Sex Bob-Omb

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #246 - Avengers Prime #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 8, 2010 - All together now! Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards, and Josh Flanagan are all crammed into one hot room to talk about the week in comics, the Book of the Month, random objects in Conor's bedroom and Step Up 3D!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #245 - The Flash #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 1, 2010 - The guys have returned from San Diego, intact. Mostly. Maybe a little loppy. This week, Ron Richards, Conor Kilpatrick, and Josh Flanagan take a look at books from a wider than normal slice of the industry, with books from six different publishers making the show. There's also a brief foray into Jerry Bruckheimer and Pearl Harbor. You know how these things go.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Batman: Under The Red Hood
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 29, 2010 - Conor Kilpatrick and staff writers Paul Montgomery and Ryan Haupt break down the latest DC Universe Animated Original film - Batman: Under The Red Hood! They discuss everything from the next short film Showcase: Jonah Hex, the movie itself, the extras, the Robins, it's all here!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #244 - Brightest Day #6
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 25, 2010 - The San Diego Comic-Con is in full swing, but that doesn't stop Conor from picking Brightest Day #6 as the pick of the week, and Josh and Ron join in the fun to discuss the books they loved and hated from this week. Recorded under guerilla conditions in their hotel room, the sound quality isn't so great and the show is a bit short, but we hope you enjoy it. We'll be back to full strength (hopefully) next week! (No show notes this week due to lack of time! We'll get them updated later in the week after we return from SD)

episodes.title: Talksplode #29 with Andy Schmidt of 5 Days to Die, IDW, and Comics Experience
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 14, 2010 - Andy Schmidt is here again! The senior editor from IDW is still at the helm of GI Joe, Transformers and other books, but he's also the writer of a new 5 issue series called 5 Days to Die, coming out weekly in September. Andy also teaches folks how to make comics like professionals do with Comics Experience. They've got a huge slate of star studded panels planned for San Diego Comic-Con. Plus, we're answering your questions! It's a giant show, and there's plenty to talk about, so dig in.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #243 - Daytripper #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 18, 2010 - San Diego looms on the horizon as the iFanboy gents gather to discuss Josh's pick of the week and fend off the madness that is the San Diego Comic Con for just a few more days. Luckily there are lots of comic books to distract them from all the laundry and prep work that still needs to be done before they reach the sunny shores of San Diego.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #242 - Scarlet #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 11, 2010 - A rare daytime recording, record temperatures in New York City, and a Thursday from hell means a groggy Conor Kilpatrick, a frazzled Ron Richards, and a really quite well-composed Josh Flanagan.

episodes.title: Talksplode #28 - Talksplode #28 with Chris Samnee of Thor: The Mighty Avenger
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 7, 2010 - Chris Samnee has come a long way, and impresses comic fans with every page he puts out. Now, as a regular artist at Marvel and other publishers, as well as one of the Comictwart group, fans have seen a lot of wonderful art from Samnee. Chris Neseman and Josh Flanagan talked with Chris about his work on this week's Thor: The Mighty Avenger, written by Roger Langridge, Vertigo's Area 10 written by Christos Gage, Siege: Embedded, The Mighty, the forthcoming Serenity: The Shepherd's Tale, and way back to Capote in Kansas. Is Samnee the hardest working man in comics, and will he draw until he drops? Is there such a thing as too much coffee? We all hope not.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #241 - Wonder Woman #600
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: July 4, 2010 - A very special Independence Day edition! Josh is off, so Jim Mroczkowski steps in to join Ron Richards and a cold medicine addled Conor Kilpatrick to try and navigate around the elephant in the room, dressed in pants and laugh in the face of the "Marvel bias".

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #240 - Sea Bear and Grizzly Shark #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 27, 2010 - They got mixed up! Conor's in San Francisco! Josh is... home! Ron is, well you don't want to know what Ron is doing. Things are hot, the hosts are beaten, and we all agree that some things are awesome, some things are awful. Concensus!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #239 - X-Factor Forever #4
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 20, 2010 - Another week, another batch of comics and this time around, we nearly had a spit-take within the first 5 minutes, which really sets the tone when you're discussing the weeks comics, your favorite creators and breaking up with you comic book store.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Jonah Hex
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 20, 2010 - Josh, Conor and Ron went to go see Jonah Hex and well, it's important to remember that this movie has nothing to do with the excellent comic books about Jonah Hex being published today. What did they think about the movie? Well, let's just say there were some...issues. Music: Oblivion Mastodon

episodes.title: Talksplode #27 - Talksplode #27 with Bob Schreck of IDW and Jurassic Park: Redemption
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 17, 2010 - Josh Flanagan talks to IDW senior editor Bob Schreck about the upcoming Jurassic Park: Redemption, the first comic he's actually scripted after years as a comics editor. Bob talks about his time as an editor at Comico and Dark Horse Comics, as well as Oni Press, a company he co-founded. Then we talk about his working relationship with such industry giants as Frank Miller, Kevin Smith, Greg Rucka, Ed Brubaker and more, and his time at DC Comics where he edited projects like Dark Knight Strikes Again, Batman, Detective Comics, All-Star Superman, All-Star Batman and Robin, and more amazing comics, as well his his move to Vertigo, and eventual dismissal from DC Comics, to where he is now at IDW. Bob Schreck has had a hand in so many of the best comics to come out in the last 20 years, and he's still at it.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #238 - Captain America #606
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 13, 2010 - Ron's back from vacation and just in time to join Josh and Cono in discussion of this week's comics as well as the Book of the Month: Wednesday Comics. So what does all that have to do with Vaudeville, Baron Zemo and Casey Kasem? Well, you'll have to listen to find out.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - The A-Team
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 13, 2010 - In 2010, a crack commando unit was sent to prison by a military court for a crime they didn't commit. These men promptly escaped from a maximum security stockade to the Los Angeles underground. Today, still wanted by the government, they survive as soldiers of fortune. If you have a problem, if no one else can help, and if you can find them, maybe you can hire... iFanboy. This week Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick take a look at Joe Carnahan's The A-Team! Does it do justice to a beloved 80s TV classic? Find out now! As always, from here on out, in the podcast and comments, you have been spoiler-warned.

episodes.title: Booksplode #5 - Invincible Iron Man Omnibus Vol. 1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 10, 2010 - Josh Flanagan, Tom Katers, and Jim Mroczkowski tuck in for a nice long discussion on Marvel's Invincible Iron Man. The first Omnibus covers the first 19 issues of the impressive run by writer Matt Fraction and artist Salvador Larroca. The discussion covers the characterization of Tony, as well as the inclusion of major storylines involving Pepper Potts, and her 'Rescue' armor, and the once maligned Maria Hill. Even Norman Osborn came out OK in this one. This story is certain to be essential Iron Man reading as the movies continue to total ever higher box office receipts, and the book does it without Robert Downey Jr.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #237 - Avengers Prime #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 6, 2010 - With Ron Richards at the beach this week, Conor Kilpatr4ick and Josh Flanagan are joined by iFanboy staff writer Paul Montgomery who returns to the the show with a list of movies. Why? You'll have to listen to find out! Also, with the temperature rising the guys get a little loopy and take the converation in some strange and unexpected directions. Cap'n Steve? Conor's equipment? Mark Wahlberg? This week's show got it all!

episodes.title: Talksplode #26 with Mike Perkins of Stephen King's The Stand
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: June 3, 2010 - Chris Neseman welcomes Mike Perkins to Talksplode for a discussion on his current work on Stephen King's The Stand and much more. Mike's career has taken him from his home in England to Poland and finally the wilds of Florida. Listen in to hear about Mike growing up on 2000 AD and Doctor Who. Mike was also a part of the fantastic work coming out of both Caliber and Cross Gen. Find out more about the creative environment and work process of both companies. Music: Stand Up Lee Fields and Sugarman and Co.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #236 - Thunderbolts #144
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 30, 2010 - With Josh Flanagan out lobstering in Maine (and possible harvesting sea urchins), the hardest working staff writer in comics, Paul Montgomery stepped up to join Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards for comic book fun time talk. And boy, did he pick a doozy of a week, with two big Avengers launches and one of the weirdest books that anyone has heard of in a long time.

episodes.title: Talksplode #25 with Rick Remender, writer of Fear Agent, X-Force and The Punisher
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 27, 2010 - iFanboy favorite Rick Remender checks in to talk about the final arc of Fear Agent, which is coming out in July and features a 5 issue arc to finish out the series. Rick also confirms the Fear Agent Omnibus and lays out the schedule for that and some shocking Fear Agent merchandise coming our way soon. In addition to Fear Agent, Rick discusses his upcoming work on X-Force for Marvel and his continuing saga on The Punisher with Franken-Castle. We also get an update on the Last Days of American Crime and finally, Rick answers many of your questions as polled from Twitter. It's always a blast to chat with Rick, so sit back and be prepared to enter the weird world of Remender! Music: Out of Step Minor Threat

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #235 - DC Universe: Legacies #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 23 2010 - It's an iFanboy miracle as Conor has returned from his travels! And we welcome him with a mirthful, chaotic episode of the Pick of the Week podcast filled with mispronunciations, disagreements, and some down right creepy talk. This is what iFanboy is all about! So sit back, grab a drink and be prepared for at least 2 spit takes. Comics: 00:02:16 - Conor visits his wheelhouse with DC Universe: Legacies #1 as the pick of the week 00:09:19 - Avengers #1 was the runner up, but easily Ron's pick of the week 00:17:20 - The Heroic Age continues with Atlas #1, which couldn't pull Ron or Josh in 00:19:19 - The sampler issue of Enter the Heroic Age #1 was enjoyable and nice taste of what's to come 00:22:27 - Josh's pick of the week was easily American Vampire #3 00:26:45 - We thought we all dropped it, but Josh is still reading Invincible Iron Man #26 00:30:13 - Conor and Ron really enjoyed Paul Dini's work on Zatanna #1 00:31:56 - Josh and Conor celebrate the end of another series with Battlefields: Firefly #3 00:33:23 - Is it over yet? Ex Machina #49, while not as bad as the last issue, is nothing compared to the earlier issues 00:35:36 - Ron and Conor agree, Joe the Barbarian #5 is the best issue yet User Reviews: 00:36:51 - NOK really dug Paul Levitz's first issue of Legion of Super-Heroes #1 00:39:26 - akamuu checks in with some glowing words for the art in Batman: Streets of Gotham #12 Book of the Month: 00:42:35 - Josh reviews the Joe Kubert graphic novel, Dong Xoai, Vietnam 1965 E-Mail: 00:50:12 - Nicholas S. from New Jersey wants to know what we think about Captain America and Steve Rogers currently Voicemail: 00:53:29 - Luke from Denver wants to know what canceled titles that we miss? 00:56:40 - Sam from Wisconsin makes it creepy by wanting to know what characters we'd like to date? Sponsors: This episode of iFanboy is brought to you by: Discount Comic Book Service - Order your comics online with savings up to 75% off! dcbservice.com Triptych Books - Help Triptych publish their first series, Trigger Men by supporting them through their Kickstarter project. All the info at www.triptychbooks.com Music: Rill Rill Sleigh Bells

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #234 - New Avengers Finale #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 16 2010 - It's one for the ages here folks, as Conor is still on vacation and Tom Katers joins Ron and Josh to tackle the tremendously large stack of comics for the past week, including the end to The Sentry saga which also may be the worst comic book printed, ever. We're not kidding here folks, this is one to remember. Comics: 00:02:03 - Josh shares with us why New Avengers Finale #1 gave him a happy end to the past 5 years of Avengers comics. 00:13:43 - Siege comes to an end this week and everyone enjoyed Siege #4 despite some nitpicks 00:17:00 - Josh enjoyed the story of Dark Avengers #16, not so much the art 00:19:01 - Siege: Embedded #4 finished strong, almost stronger than Siege #4 for Tom 00:21:30 - There are no words to describe Stentry: Fallen Sun 00:31:59 - Over at DC, the big Batman: Return of Bruce Wayne story kicked off with issue #1 with some great art 00:34:32 - Ron was surprised at how good Hulk #22 was 00:37:05 - Tom is sickened by the death in Titans Villains for Hire Special #1 00:40:19 - BPRD: King of Fear #5 delivered good comics for Tom 00:41:28 - Flash #2 keeps the positive vibes of the Flash going for Ron and Tom 00:42:38 - The Luna Brothers finished their latest epic with The Sword #24 and Ron's glad its over 00:43:10 - It's another insane death in X-Men Forever #23 00:44:12 - Josh really enjoyed the end of the Marvels Project #8... 00:45:06 - ...but he didn't enjoy Transformers: Ironhide #1 so much 00:46:15 - And finally, we gave Birds of Prey #1 a shot, and it wasn't awful User Reviews: 00:48:45 - akamuu enjoyed Sentry: Fallen Sun which leads us to wonder what comic he actually read 00:50:10 - ctrosejr had a more realistic opinion of Sentry: Fallen Sun E-Mail: 00:52:46 - Steve has some questions about filling the gaps in our collections Sponsors: This episode of iFanboy is brought to you by: Audible - get all your audiobooks at Audible - sign up for a free trial at audiblepodcast.com/ifanboy Instock Trades and Summit City Comic Con - Get great prices on all sorts of trades, hardcovers and collections! Music: Northwest Apartment Band of Horses

episodes.title: Talksplode #24 with Ruwan Jayatilleke - Iron Man: Extremis Motion Comic
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 12, 2010 - For the past year or so, Marvel has been producing and releasing motion comics to the public. These slightly animated adaptations of popular works have been much discussed by fans and discovered by non-fans alike. The latest entry is Iron Man: Extremis, adapting Warren Ellis and Adi Granov's classic story. We spoke with Ruwan Jayatilleke, a VP at Marvel, about Iron Man: Extremis, the various motion comics from Marvel, what the difference between a motion comic and animation is, as well as some speculation over future motion comics from Marvel for Captain America and Thor. If you haven't checked out Iron Man: Extremis, be sure to check out the trailer to episode 3, which was released on May 12. More information about Marvel Motion Comics can be found at Marvel.com/motioncomics. Music: Iron On Superchunk

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #233 - Astonishing Spider-Man + Wolverine #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 9, 2010 - Conor can't escape internation extraidition laws, so Ron and Josh welcome Evie Nagy of the Awesomed By Comics podcast to fill the big man's chair. Evie brings a biting wit and an appreciation of Gail Simone to the show, and boy do the sparks fly as she and Josh become enemies and then frenemys. Comics: 00:02:16 - Ron was surprised to be picking Astonishing Spider-Man and Wolverine #1 00:11:29 - Uncanny X-Men #524 was a close pick until the end and Wolverine's reaction 00:18:29 - Evie drops some knowledge on Secret Six #21 00:26:35 - Josh found the art choices on Batman and Robin #12 interesting 00:31:48 - For 1 dollar, you can't go wrong with Mike Allred's art on iZombie #1 00:33:44 - It doesn't get better than Hellboy in Mexico 00:36:40 - We all think that there are just too many characters in Brightest Day #1 00:38:20 - Finally! Astro City: The Dark Age #4 ends this ongoing saga! 00:40:30 - Demo #4 continues be great, with this issue featuring some very Manga-esque art from Becky Cloonan User Reviews: 00:43:00 - dworden is really digging Spider-Man Fever #2 00:44:30 - Zombox thought War of the Super-Men got off to a good start E-Mail: 00:47:19 - Gary Lewis has some thoughts about the death of Nightcrawler and what it means to comics Voicemail: 00:50:25 - John from Philadelphia has an idea about getting sketches at cons Etc.: Go subscribe to iFanboy: Don't Miss to hear a preview of a book coming out this week. This week we've got Jeph Loeb talking Hulk #22 Josh spoke to Joe Kubert in our latest Talksplode, you don't want to miss this one Iron Man 2 came out this week and Josh and Ron have opinions of it! Go listen to Evie on Awesomed By Comics and follow Evie on Twitter! Sponsors: This episode of iFanboy is brought to you by: Triptych Books - Go donate to Triptych's Kickstarter project to help their comic, Trigger Men, become a reality! Discount Comic Book Service and Summit City Comic Con - Get great prices on all sorts of trades, hardcovers and collections! Music: The High Road Broken Bells

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Iron Man 2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 9, 2010 - The anticipated sequel, Iron Man 2, directed by Jon Favreau and starring Robert Downey, Jr., Gwenyth Paltrow, Sam Rockwell, Don Cheadle, Samuel L. Jackson, Mickey Rourke, and Scarlett Johannsen hit theaters this weekend and Josh and Ron gather to discuss. Did it surpass the original movie? Did the various things like Whiplash, Black Widow and War Machine work or not so much? Is Robert Downey. Jr the coolest thing since sliced bread? Or maybe Sam Rockwell is. What was the easter egg at the end of the movie's credits? All this and more on this spoiler-rich discussion of Iron Man 2!

episodes.title: Talksplode #23 with Joe Kubert
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 6, 2010 - Joe Kubert, creator of our Book of the Month for May, Dong Xoai, Vietnam 1965, has been working in comics since before his voice changed. He's seen the industry in all its various forms, writing and drawing comics like Tor and Our Army at War, with Sgt. Rock. More recently, he found acclaim with his graphic novels Fax from Sarajevo and Yossel: April, 19, 1943. He also started the Joe Kubert School of Cartoon and Graphic Art to train young comics artists for work in the world comics. Today, at 83 years old, he's still working, still drawing, and knows how lucky he is for it. Josh Flanagan had a conversation with Joe about his career and his new graphic novel. If this doesn't make you love comics, then nothing will. Music: Down the Line Jose Gonzalez

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #232 - Green Lantern Corps #47
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: May 2, 2010 - Some wiseguys named Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards are back together talking about comics! Ron's true accent comes out, Josh reveals a bias, and Conor gets a little bit too personal.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #231 - The Brave and The Bold #33
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 25, 2010 - While Ron was still trapped in Chicago, the show must go on, so it's only appropriate that Chicago's own Chris Neseman stepped up to yak about this week's comics with Josh and Conor. Coincidence? Give us back our side-burned friend, Neseman!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - The Losers
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 25, 2010 - The second comic book movie of 2010, and one of the most anticipated in the iFanboy offices, The Losers came out this weekend. Josh, Ron and Conor gather to discuss the film adaptation of Andy Diggle and Jock's work, which was published by Vertigo/DC Comics. Did the cinematic feel and high action of the comic translate to the big screen? What did the filmmakers get wrong or go to far with? And most importantly, would Ron's dad like this movie? You'll have to listen to find out!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #230 - Flash #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 18, 2010 - With Conor supposedly en route to some or other comic convention, we learn once more than Tom Katers wasn't doing anything, and was free to join Josh and Ron to talk about this week's books, which is apropos, since he's kinda got a thing for Flash comics. Get out your checklists, or don't if that's your thing, but there are a lot of comics to cover here!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Kick-Ass
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 16, 2010 - The comic book from Mark Millar and John Romita Jr. was mightily F'ed up, and now it's time to see if the movie version lives up to that same standard. Kick-Ass hits theaters today, with Matthew Vaughn directing, and Josh, Ron, and Conor all saw it, and figure out if it does indeed kick ass. Featuring Nic Cage, and young female actress with the most permissive parents in the history of cinema, it is time for Kick-Ass.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #229 - Jonah Hex #54
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 11, 2010 - Hey, they're back! After handing off the show to the writers, Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick have returned in the first heat-influenced show of the year! Plus, the language gets super salty when discussing one particular book, Conor reveals the uncomfortable origins of his Power Pack problem and Josh still has a Tom Katers complex.

episodes.title: Talksplode #22 with John Romita Jr., artist of Kick-Ass and Avengers
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 08, 2010 - John Romita Jr. has been an A-list artist for the past 30 years. Primarily known for his work at Marvel Comics with legendary runs on Uncanny X-Men, Amazing Spider-Man, Thor and many other projects like World War Hulk, The Sentry, The Punisher: War Zone and more, Romita Jr. has followed in the footsteps of his father, John Romita Sr., making great Marvel Comics. Recently, his foray into creator owned work with Mark Millar gave us Kick-Ass, the realistic/hyper violent tale of a kid who becomes a super hero. As we all know, Kick-Ass has been adapted into a movie by Matthew Vaughn and is set to be released next week. Josh Flanagan and Ron Richards jumped at the chance to chat with John Romita Jr., and talked about the following things: * His working relationship with Millar on Kick-Ass and what the movie making prcoess has been like * His interest in creator owned work, including his upcoming project with Howard Chaykin, Shmuggy and Bimbo, which he confirmed will be published through the Icon line at Marvel Comics. * His upcoming work with Brian Michael Bendis on Avengers, which includes Kang as the villain in issue #1 John Romita Jr. is truly one of the good guys in comics and we hope you enjoy this conversation. Music: Bad Reputation Joan Jett and The Blackhearts

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #228 - Blackest Night #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: April 4, 2010 - The animals have overtaken the zoo for the second annual iFanboy.com Staff Writer POW show! Paul Montgomery, Jim Mroczkowski, and Mike Romo take to the mic and talk about all of their favorite books of the week. Well, part of the time, anyway. There's also some griping. Don't worry though. They let Josh out of the meat freezer for a few minutes so he can talk about his pick, the landmark Blackest Night #8.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #227 - Uncanny X-Men #522
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 28, 2010 - The results of the voicemail contest are in and we've got an extra long show so we can bring you the Top Five Voicemails from the deluge that we received this week! Were you the winner? Also, we love My Blue Heaven and Ron has no idea what day it is.

episodes.title: Booksplode #4 - Starman Omnibus Vol. 2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 25, 2010 - We're back on the horse people! After a long hiatus, Booksplode has returned, to talk, in depth about a particularly good graphic novel or comic collection, and now we're doing Starman Omnibus Vol. 2 with Josh Flanagan, Conor Kilpatrick, and Paul Montgomery. This book continues the stories set up by James Robinson back in the first volume, and expands Jack Knight's world and relationships exponentially. With regular art by Tony Harris, at the top of his game, and guest art from luminaries like JH Williams III, Chris Sprouse, Guy Davis, and more, this book is a joy to behold on almost every page. Get ready for a whole lot of praise for a whole lot of good comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #226 - Siege #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 21, 2010 - A great week of comic books makes Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan, and Ron Richards jovial! The Pick of the Week allows for a lot of giddy catharsis, one very long e-mail allows for introspection, and an old nemesis returns! All of this and a new giveaway open to everyone!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #225 - Batman and Robin #10
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 14, 2010 - 2 of 3 are off to Seattle for Emerald City Comicon, but still, a show gets made! Thrill to the sounds of Conor's smooth and jazzy voice, and listen as we try to dole out more comic book related wedding advice. Also, the art sucked. Which art? How much time do you have?

episodes.title: Talksplode #21 with Jim McCann writer of Hawkeye and Mockingbird
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 10, 2010 - Jim McCann is a longtime fan of Hawkeye and Mockingbird, and writer of the just announced ongoing series, Hawkeye and Mockingbird from Marvel Comics! Fellow Clint Barton fan, Josh talks to Jim about the famed archer and his wife, the return to the purple costume, the roots of his affection for the characters, and his still young writing career. We also talk about McCann's upcoming original graphic novel with Archaia Studios Press, Return of the Dapper Men. Talksplode highlights: * Coming out of the heroic age, Hawkeye and Mockingbird #1 will debut in June with an extra sized issue, following a short story in Enter the Heroic Age in May. * Clint and Bobbie will continue their adventures with their group, the World Counter-Terrorism Agency, or the W.C.A., which sounds a lot like an acronym for West Coast Avengers, complete with a new high tech headquarters * The title will be set up by Brian Michael Bendis in New Avengers #63 and #64.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #224 - Buffy the Vampire Slayer #33
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: March 7, 2010 - Josh Flanagan is back! And boy his arms are tired. His arms, and everything else. He joins Ron Richards and Conor Kilpatrick to talk about this week's comics, get really touchy about the whole Tom Katers lovefest, and possibly fall asleep during the show.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #223 - New Avengers #62
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 28, 2010 - With Josh Flanagan still out on paternity leave, Tom Katers returns to join Conor Kilpatrick and Ron Richards to discuss the new comics of the week, drug dependency, alcohol abuse, and the ways that Atlantians show affection. Plus, Conor completely blanks on the name Luna Park.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 25, 2010 - Worlds collide as Conor Kilpatrick, Paul Montgomery, and Chris Neseman gather to discuss the seventh DC Universe animated original movie, Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths. When Lex Luthor shows up on the Justice League's orbiting watchtower claiming to be the last surviving member of an alternate Earth's JLA, will anyone believe him? Does the League have any chance against the nefarious Crime Syndicate? Does Ultraman wear Queens pants in his off time? How does it all stack up against the other projects produced under Bruce Timm, and what does the future have in store for animated comic book adaptations? More importantly, does Conor have a sinister plan to exterminate humanity?

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #222 - Blackest Night: Flash #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 21, 2010 - We celebrate the arrival of Baby Flanagan with an extra long show! And sitting in for the new dad is infamous recluse Tom Katers! With Conor having had a few celebratory cocktails and Tom hopped up on pain pills for a bad back, this episode started out with one foot in the danger zone!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #221 - Amazing Spider-Man #620
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 14, 2010 - We're all in house, talking about a big load of comics, giveaways, and our usual diversions. Come for the comics talk. Stay for the uncomfortably pregnancy jokes. New York was snowed in, but like the postal service, you can't stop comics!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #220 - Siege #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 7, 2010 - February 7, 2010 - The gang's all here as Conor Kilpatrick, Ron Richards and Josh Flanagan gather together after a long day of work to babble about the week's comics. And not just some of the comics. In a special one-time only event, the iFanboys break format and talk about ALL of the comics that they read from the past week. Who's idea was this? They don't know but they'd like to find him or her and kick their ass.

episodes.title: Talksplode #20 with Brian Wood writer of Demo, DMZ, Northlanders and DV8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: February 4, 2010 - Brian Wood is stranger to the iFanboy Talksplode, but we've never had more to talk about than what Brian's got going on this month. With Demo #1 by Wood and artist Becky Cloonan coming out in comic stores yesterday, 6 years after volume 1 starts, and DMZ #50 coming out next week with an all star collection of artists, and Northlanders #25 later this month continuing the best arc of the series yet AND DV8 #1 finally coming out in April, Brian's been a busy guy. On top of all that, he also has been working on getting the next volume of the New York Four rolling with Ryan Kelly, so we're flattered that he found an hour to chat with us about his books

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #219 - Detective Comics #861
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 31, 2010 - Something was in the air this week, maybe it was the crap ton of comics that came out this week, that lead Josh to pick Detective Comics #861 as the pick, and Ron and Conor to go a little insane on the show this week. And perhaps the dorkiest joke ever made occurred. All in all, a good time when it comes to talkin' comics while wearing an ascot and Richard Dreyfuss makes an appearance.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #218 - Power Girl #8
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 24, 2010 - This week on the iFanboy Pick of the Week Podcast: Conor gushes about his favorite book of the week, an innocuous e-mail leads to a long and wide ranging discussion about hoarding media, and hey, hide the booze and the porn and cancel the strippers -- who let the kid in here?

episodes.title: Talksplode #19 with Scott Allie writer of Solomon Kane and Managing Editor at Dark Horse Comics
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 21, 2010 - Scott Allie is the managing editor at Dark Horse Comics, where he edits many of the most successful comics at Dark Horse, like Hellboy, The Goon and Buffy The Vampire Slayer. In addition to his editing duties, he is also an accomplished writer. Well versed in the horror genre, Allie's latest work came out this past Wednesday, Solomon Kane: Death's Black Riders #1. He also published an original graphic novel last fall called Exubria.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #217 - S.W.O.R.D. #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 17, 2010 - Things settle back to normal, or as close to normal as they can get as the discussion of Ron's pick of the week of S.W.O.R.D. #3 devolves into 90210 discussion and crazy fandom, as well as other trips down distraction lane, ending with a hard look at Josh's personal relationships. Oh yeah, we talk about comic books too.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #216 - Sweet Tooth #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: January 10, 2010 - The iFanboy Pick of the Week Podcast returns with the first new episode of 2010! It was late at night, Ron and Conor were drinking and it was broadcast live over USTREAM! And not only that but a deep freeze in the northeast of the United States meant that Josh and Conor's internet connection made them sound like they were calling in from Alaska!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com + Murmur.com 2009 Year End All Media Spectacular!
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 27, 2009 - It's the fourth annual All Media Year End Round Up where Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, and Conor Kilpatrick discuss everything they enjoyed in 2009 from movies, to television, to music, to video games and of course, to comic books. Enjoy!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #215 - Forgetless #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 20, 2009 - We're close to the end of the year and iFanboy is running on fumes. Listen in horror as Josh, Conor and Ron try to keep it together to make it through one last pick of the week before the holidays set in, and good thing it was a controversy free week of comics at iFanboy....oh wait a minute...d'oh! We cover up the controversy with 14 year old pop culture references. Happy Holidays!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #214- Daytripper #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 13, 2009 - Another late night recording brings another wacky show! The holidays are fast approaching and on everyone's mind this week as each of the iFanboys reveals something about himself and it gets progressively more disturbing. Were their any penises in Josh's Book of the Month selection? There's only one way to find out, True Believers!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #213- The Mighty #11
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 6, 2009 - A late night recording bring more wackiness and insanity as Josh talks about The Mighty #11, his pick of the week, and Ron and Conor have a hard time maintaining their composure, while navigating the spoilers thrown at us by the publishers. Any show with Liberace references and when you hear "Two of Us," you know you're in for quite a ride

episodes.title: Talksplode #18 - Breaking In to Comics with CB Cebulski, Ron Perazza and Stephen Christy
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: December 4, 2009 - Have you ever wanted to break into comics as a writer, artist, letterer, colorist, or whatever? Josh Flanagan has an in-depth conversation with the guys who know how it works. Join C.B. Celbulski, Marvel's Talent Scout, Ron Perazza, Vice President of Creative Services for DC Comics, and Stephen Christy, Director of Development for Archaia Studios Press, as we talk about how to get your career started in comics, from independent publishers to the big two, this conversation covers a lot of ground, so make sure you take notes. Make sure to follow Perazza, Cebulski, and Christy on Twitter as well, for more information on making comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #212 - Blackest Night #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 29, 2009 - It's post Thanksgiving here in the United States and Josh is still eating so Paul Montgomery steps in and joins Ron and Conor for a packed week of comics as they discuss event comics, colored lantern rings, Christopher Reeve and much more. Let the holiday season begin!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #211 - The Flash: Rebirth #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 22, 2009 - Things go flying off the rails almost immediately in this extra-long episode of the Pick of the Week Podcast! A blown call time and technical difficulties throw everything out of whack and the show descends into madness as the week in comics share time with Nazi fashion, the Lethal Weapon movies, Zombie Roy Disney, more Tom Petty hate, and the return of an old running joke!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #210 - B.P.R.D. 1947 #5
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 15, 2009 - The gang's back together as Ron and Josh gather in Conor's bedroom to fight about G.I. Joe, make each other uncomfortable, and try to keep a lid on the loopiness. Is Conor now, or has he ever been, a member of H.E.A.T.? Find out this week!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #209 -  Lobo: Highway to Hell #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 8, 2009 - Something must be in the water because there's an extra helping of loopy in this week's edition of the iFanboy Pick of the Week Podcast, as Ron explains his oddball Pick of the Week, Josh gets a new last name, and Conor rings the irony bell.

episodes.title: Talksplode #17 with cartoonist Mike Dawson of Freddie and Me, Ace Face, and Jack and Max
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 5, 2009 - Josh talks to cartoonist Mike Dawson about his work on former Book of the Month Freddie and Me, Ace Face, his work with Act-I-Vate web comics group, and his podcast with fellow cartoonist Alex Robinson, the Ink Panthers Show. Plus, we decide to go out and destroy the Josh Flanagan and Mike Dawson who stole our URLs.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #208 - Detective Comics #858
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: November 1, 2009 - It's a big show this week as a ton of books came out and Josh, Conor and Ron were overwhelmed. So overwhelmed in fact that they had to resort to emergency measures...THE BELL! That's right, The Bell is back! Long time listeners will be excited by this news, while new users may be confused, but we're sure you'll dig it.

episodes.title: Talksplode #16 with Andy Schmidt - Senior Editor at IDW
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 29, 2009 - Josh takes time to chat with Andy Schmidt, the Senior Editor at IDW. Andy came up working at Marvel Comics, starting as an assistant editor under Tom Brevoort, and being promoted to full editor, where he oversaw such projects as Alias, and the Annihilation event. At IDW, Andy is in charge of the current G.I. Joe, Transformers, and Star Trek comics lines. As if that wasn't enough, Andy is the founder of ComicsExperience.com, offering online classes in making comics, from writing to penciling to coloring. Additionally, Andy's also a freelance writer, all at the same time. Make sure you listen for the secret origin of GI Joe Cobra as well!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #207 - Invincible Iron Man #19
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 25, 2009 - Conor resurfaces (or was released bu the authorities) back to the fold as he joins Ron and Josh for a rousing discussion of the world of comics including unexpected surprises, overthinking realism in comics and even some Halloween fun.

episodes.title: Talksplode #15 with Briand Wood - writer of Northlanders
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 27, 2009 - Tomorrow, Northlanders #21 hits comic stands with the first part of an 8 issue story arc entitled "The Plague Widow." Writer Brian Wood and new to Northlanders artist Leandro Fernandez take you to the cold of Russia in 1020 A.D. for this tale of crime, survival and historical fiction. Brian Wood stopped by and chatted with us for a little bit to tell us about this new issue of Northlanders, from the setting and the basic story to the origins of the research involved with putting this story together. We also find out about what it's like to work with a new artist like Leandro Fernandez and the challenges of giving an artist from South America a story set in Russia in the winters. The Vertigo blog recently highlighted the art of Leandro Fernandez where you can see some dazzling pencils to inks. So give a listen and if you enjoy crime stories, or historical fiction, or survival horror, Northlanders #21 may be a good book to check out at the comic book store tomorrow.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #206 - Liberty Comics #2
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 18, 2009 - You think the show's a little long this week? Well, you try keeping things under an hour with guest podcaster Chris Neseman of Around Comics and 11 O'Clock Comics in the house! We manage to quash the rivalry for the length of the show, and get to doing what we do best, making fun of each other, and also managing to talk about a bunch of comics.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #205 - Irredeemable #7
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 11, 2009 - Conor wishes it was 5 years ago so he could split his pick, while Josh would have gone with the other book, and Ron is back from vacation and somehow Jeff Lynne gets bashed and June Lockhart makes an appearance in this madcap edition of the iFanboy Pick of the Week podcast

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #204 - G.I. Joe Cobra Special #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 4, 2009 - Ron is gallivanting about the Europe, or Ohio, or somewhere. We forget, but in his stead, staff writer Mike Romo fills in, and it's important to note that we, the producers of iFanboy and its related affiliates take no responsibility for Mike's words or opinions, even if you really like the books he's talking about. Plus, there's fun with the mute button! All on this week's iFanb--

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Superman/Batman: Public Enemies
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: October 4, 2009 - Conor Kilpatrick, Josh Flanagan and staff writer Paul Montgomery team up to discuss Superman/Batman: Public Enemies, the animated adaptation of the first six issues of Superman/Batman which were written by Jeph Loeb and drawn by Ed McGuinness and featured a cavalcade of characters from the DC Universe. The discussion of the movie itself leads to a wider talk about superhero animation and how it compares with comic book storytelling. Also, Voltron.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #203 - Fantastic Four #571
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 27, 2009 - This week, after discussing the unanimous choice of Fantastic Four #571 as Pick of the Week, we talk about some other books, sure, but most importantly we mull plans for a new kind of podcast altogether. It's possible it it might not catch on. Also, Ron hasn't been paying attention to Conor's middle name.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Surrogates
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 27, 2009 - Conor Kilpatrick and Sonia Harris team up to talk about Surrogates! And despite an overmodulated microphone that causes Conor to, at times, sounds like a robot (ironically), they still manage to talk about Real Dolls, World of WarCraft, and, oh yes, the movie.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #202 - Vengeance of The Moon Knight #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 20, 2009 - A surprise Pick of the Week selection throws the whole world into turmoil and dredges up memories of the great Scalped #30/Blackest Night #1 Controversy of 2009. How will the iFanboy world survive? And what happens when a complex sex-related e-mail lands in the in-box? All of this plus -- has Josh revealed himself to be transgendered?

episodes.title: Booksplode #3 - Asterios Polyp
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 17, 2009 - Asterios Polyp by David Mazzucchelli seemingly came from out of nowhere and is the iFanboy Book of the Month for September 2009. Join Josh Flanagan, Ron Richards, Paul Montgomery, and Conor Kilpatrick from iFanboy.com as they discuss just what is so great about this book. It turns out, there are many things.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #201- Kick-Ass #7
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 13, 2009 - After the 200th extravaganza, we're back to Josh, Conor and Ron all by their lonesomes. But don't fret. A week filled with great art and many industry/business happenings provides for a jam packed week, especially since the books came out on Thursday *grumble grumble*.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - Whiteout
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 13, 2009 - Conor and Ron go into the cold to check out the movie adaptation of Greg Rucka and Steve Leiber's graphic novel Whiteout and come out of it not ready to blast it, but not ready to praise it either.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #200 - Sweet Tooth #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: September 6, 2009 - It's our big 200th episode, recorded live in front of a comic book audience on September 4th at Jim Hanley's Universe! We talk the books of the week and take lots of audience questions. If you were there, you might have even gotten a prize. You should have been there. It was a lot of fun!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #199 - Batman and Robin #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 30, 2009 - With Josh off fishing for urchins... sea urchins (it's a hell of a way to earn a livin', don'tcha know), Conor and Ron trolled the bars for a guest host and found Jason Wood from 11 O'Clock Comics! This week, Ron admits he has a problem, Conor gets bamboozled, and Jason reveals the secrets behind his show!

episodes.title: Talksplode #14 with Rick Remender - writer of Fear Agent, The Punisher and Dr. Voodoo
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 27, 2009 - Ron Richards checks in with an iFanboy favorite, writer Rick Remender to hear about his upcoming series Doctor Voodoo: Avenger of the Supernatural. In addition to Doctor Voodoo, there's some lengthy discussion about The Punisher, Fear Agent, Rick's upcoming crime comic from Radical Comics, Last Days of American Crime and a quick update on all the movies that are development based on Rick's creator owned work like Fear Agent, Night Mary and XXXombies. Rick is always a blast to chat with and you can tell he loves what he's writing these days and it's interesting to hear what his opinions are around his move to Marvel and making comics in general. Plus, he's funny - so it's worth a listen purely for the laughs.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #198 - Daredevil #500
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 23, 2009 - It's the combination of several milestones that leads Ron to the pick of the week, as we also interrupt law enforcement and recycle some classic Simpsons jokes.

episodes.title: Booksplode #2 - Queen and Country Definitive Edition Vol. 1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 20, 2009 - Queen and Country has been a long time favorite in the iFanboy offices for years. It was even Book of the Month last year. We gather up some of the staff for another in depth discussion on the relative merits of the first volume of Queen and Country Definitive Edition by Greg Rucka, Steve Rolston, Brian Hurtt, and Leandro Fernandez. Join Josh Flanagan, Paul Montgomery, Sonia Harris and Jim Mroczkowski as they talk about how good this story actually is, British euphemisms and their correct usage, and the relative size of breasts and noses

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #197 - The Marvels Project #1
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 16, 2009 - Conor's still off gallivanting around God knows where, so we've got to fill in somehow, and luckily, there was a stray podcaster by the name of Tom Katers who happened to be hanging around, so we pulled him him. Ron and Josh agree on almost nothing this episode, and Tom just wants more gorillas with rifles.

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Pick of the Week #196 - Chew #3
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
episodes.summary: August 9, 2009 - It's MAYHEM at iFanboy as Conor clocks in with the summer's indie hit, Chew as the Pick of the Week amidst a wide array of comics this week. MAYHEM!

episodes.title: iFanboy.com Special Edition Podcast - G.I. Joe: Rise of Cobra
episodes.author: ifanboy.com
